Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Steven G
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel in a mystery hotel on lastminute.com so not sure what the normal price is but we got it cheap. The hotel is in a perfect location! Wouldn't have wanted to be anywhere else in Amsterdam after spending days there we really appreciated the location. The staff were friendly, the rooms were clean, the internet was a good speed. The room was really stylish and modern also. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but cramped”
Reviews.Author: Seven08
Reviews.Content: My mother and I had booked a twin room. On arrival, it turned out that the twin room in fact consisted of a double bed with two single mattresses and two quilts on it. We both like our space and this was much too cramped. There was no room for manoeuvre either, as there were fixed bedside tables on both sides. In saying that, the hotel was in a great location and was very clean. Just a pity about the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located near the central station and a short walk from the Joordan district.”
Reviews.Author: JAME-OH
Reviews.Content: Arriving from Japan, my wife and I wanted to stay at a hotel near the Central Station, since we assumed we would be jetlagged and didn't want to spend too much time getting to the hotel. The staff was fine, check in and out were smooth. The rooms well decorated but pretty small. Having seen other peoples' reviews and pictures on T.A. it wasn't a surprise though. Location is the best thing about this hotel. About a 10 minute walk from Amsterdam Central station. Also a few minutes walk to the very nice Joordan district, where we spend quite a bit of time at cafes and on patios by the river. It's located on one of the main arteries of the city with convenient access to tram lines. If location is the most important thing for you, then book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Alan J
Reviews.Content: The room was very comfortable. I had requested a three bed room for myself anf two daughters and the layout wokrd very well. The location and convenience weer great. The only downside is the fact that my kids don't eat much breakfast usually which made the hotel breakfast the Euros 12:50 rather uneconomical.

Reviews.Title: “Plush hotel for a budget price”
Reviews.Author: RichSBarnsley_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night (Â£160 for a 3 bed room), would certainly spend more time here though. Very convenient location, close to the train station, walking distance, but just 1 stop on the tram. The tram stop is just opposite the hotel. We arrived at about 11am, but our room was ready so able to check in. We'd taken an overnight ferry from England, and just having the 1 night in Amsterdam it was good that we could check in straight away and leave our bags, so we could maximise our time in the city. The room was lovely. I was staying with my wife and her 23 year old daughter (visiting us from the US), so we had a 3 person room. This consisted of 2 single beds pushed together, with a 3rd single bed in a corner of the room behind a screen. Large screen TV which even had BBC channels, not that we were watching much TV. It was a sizable room, and we felt we had enough privacy. The bathroom was a little strange with a glass door (partly frosted), but well equipped and a vet good and sizable shower cubicle. The following morning we could leave our bags in a secure store room whilst we explored more of the city, and then pick them up before heading the short distance back to the station. You can book breakfast the day before for a discount but we preferred to venture out and find a pancake house! Down the side street across the road is an excellent bar called "In De Wildeman", highly recommended if you are a beer aficionado, carrying various draught beers from around the world and a wide range of bottles. The hotel is a short walk from the red light district, and many coffee shops in the vicinity. Much of the city is within walking distance, but a visitor tram ticket (1 to 5 days I think, we got a 2 day ticket for â‚¬12) is worth getting and then you can get a little closer. Would certainly consider this hotel again if we choose to travel back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Muinteoir_Mishka
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. Our room was facing onto the street where the trams travel so I was a bit nervous about the noise from there but I have to say noise was definitely not a problem! The windows are very thick and once they are closed we found that noise from the street was minimal! The location of this hotel is brilliant - 5 minutes from central station and 5 minutes from Dam Square! The trams literally stop outside the door which is very handy too! The one thing I would say is make sure that you are comfortable with the person you are travelling with! The rooms are very small and oddly shaped and when people say that the walls of the bathroom are glass, they are not exaggerating! They are clear glass at the top and bottom and frosted glass in the middle! I found this a bit unnerving at the beginning! You do have to just avert your eyes and look out the window or at the television while your friend uses the bathroom! Saying that though, I would stay here again and I would recommend it to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: jbjrz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was overall ok, and my review would probably be more positive if it weren't for the following: too pricey and with a discomforting bed. I don't know much about the Netherlands average price for hotels, but after travelling up and down all Europe, I expected something more for almost 200 euros per night, no breakfast included. The room was very small and the bathroom was separated by glass only, that requires some good level of closeness with your roommate... But then again, I would have found it a good deal if we were paying half the price. The double bed was made by two separate matrasses and separate blanketts and linen. Again, in the beginning I thought it was the Netherland way, but on day three of my stay I heard another customer asking to change his room for this reason, and he got it. We decided not to ask to change our room because it was our last night anyway. The staff was helpful and the hotel sells tkts to the main museums, which spares you endless lines. Clean enough and very quite (the windows have double glasses). Great location, 3 minutes walk from Dam square. I would eventually recommend it, if at a better price.

Reviews.Title: “Easter weekend”
Reviews.Author: B C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Pro: located in the heart of Amsterdam; everything your travellers guide tells you to see is in walking distance of max. 30min; very friendly checkin; receptionists allways friendly and helpful; liked the glass walls of the bathroom Con: not the cleanest room I've seen but still ok; use of the toilet might be a challenge for "bigger" people :-)

Reviews.Title: “3 day break”
Reviews.Author: Tanyacherie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from April 4th - 7th. This hotel is a 5 min walk from Central station. This was gereat for us because we flew in to Eindhoven, got the bus to Central station in Amsterdam. Its also 5 min from Dam Square. Hotel room is small as are most in Amsterdam. Bathroom however is big with a great shower. Staff in hotel are friendly. Hotel is spotless. Amsterdam is a lovely city with loads to see. Leidsplein area is probably my favourite. I found the cheapest rate for this hotel on Lastminute.com. It averaged out about 140 euro's a night, midweek. A small complaint....I left a key behind and emailed the hotel as soon as I got home. The haven't yet replied!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay in Amsterdam !!”
Reviews.Author: Nin_Singh
Reviews.Content: Tend to visit Amsterdam at least every 8 to 10 weeks for a few days and in the last year alone I must have stayed at the Westcord for around 7 or 8 trips, for at least 3 nights per trip (some even longer). Having stayed at several other local hotels too, put simply... in my opinion the Westcord is hands down the best place to stay in the central amsterdam area. Great location and not too long a walk from central station (so not too many a cobbled streets for the poor wheels of my suitcase to have to contend with) all whilst within easy walking distance of several Coffeeshops, Shops / Stores, Places to eat and easily accessible tram stops to get you wherever you need to go in the city. There's some great nightlife spots nearby too. The staff are always brilliant and helpful, even when strolling in during the early hours in the morning after a night out, you'll always get a smile and hello from the person on reception. They majority of times i check in on my various trips i always seem to have been served by the same lady (she's actually photographed on this site holding the phone to her ear) to the point where now i'm immediately recognized as soon as i stroll through those reception doors and she always immediately greets me with a fond hello, smile and a 'welcome back sir'. As for the rooms themselves, every one i've stayed in has had a comfortable bed, always in very clean condition and unlike other hotels nearby, the walk to the room does not involve a lot of walking within the hotel due to its straightforward layout. The showers in the trendy ensuites are simply divine, and for me personally a good shower is the mark of a good hotel. Room service always does a good job cleaning the room and never have i had any items go missing (even though i tend to leave my laptop / ipod and associated bits and pieces lying around on my desk while i am out). I tend to stay in the Deluxe rooms which has a functional secure safe in the room with a digital keypad if required as well as air conditioning. Flat screen tv's mounted on the wall in these rooms too easily watchable from bed, plus with free wifi available in the rooms and downstairs in reception, why would you want to stay anywhere else. To conclude, I'm back in Amsterdam again in a few weeks and will be looking to book another 10 nights in total at the Westcord.... says it all really !!! Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Craig H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westcord in early April on a Sunday night whilst on a mini break from the UK. The reception staff were very welcoming and checked us into our room very early, despite us arriving at 10:00am (5 hours before the normal check in time). The room was clean, modern and very chilled out. The hotel is in a superb location, just a 5 minute walk from Dam Square and Centraal Station. Would highly recommend this hotel to couples/families/young people off on a break to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “my favourite place to stay”
Reviews.Author: fetishamuse
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favourite hotels in Amsterdam and I have stayed there at least half a dozen times and always enjoyed it. I'm slightly loathed to write this review as it may become a bit too popular, but they do deserve my recommendation, so here goes. First of all the good things. The location is excellent. It's a short walk away from Central Station and really well connected. There's a tram stop just outside and 2 bike rental companies just round the corner (the Yellow Bike company in front, and White Bike behind). A hot tip (for any newbies to the City) is to get the train from the airport to Central Station and walk to the hotel. Use a map if you're unsure, but as long as you go to the right-most exit from the station, you'll be just 5 minutes from your room! The rooms are small..just enough for one, probably two if you're an intimate couple. I always get the "deluxe" rooms which are modern and funky. Be warned that the bathroom is a frosted glass cubicle, so you'll have to be comfy with your partner possibly "enjoying" the view! By Amsterdam standards though, they are fine and very clean. One of the annoying things about the rooms is the location of the light switches: they are on the headboard, so if you lay in bed watching telly or reading a book, you'll find yourself playing disco-lights accidentally! ... I've never got used to this (the designer should be rudely told off! ;) ) The other potentially annoying thing is the sound of the council trucks cleaning up in the morning: it pays to get a high-up room to avoid the traffic noise (it is a city after all). The other thing I've enjoyed about this place is the staff. They aren't hugely outgoing or overtly try to help, just very normal and friendly and cosily, unfussily welcoming. Peter has been there for a while now, and I often see the same faces which is nice. Like any place, if you smile, they smile back :) The hotel is easy walking distance to the main attractions: the Flower Market, Leidseplein (a little further), Dam Square, and the Red Light district. If you fancy something different, one of my favourite times was hiring a bike; taking the cheap ferry (the other side of the station) across to the North and cycling around all the pretty (old fashioned) dutch dwellings alongside the canals: it's a much quieter and calmer experience than the usual and recommended on any sunny day. Back to the locality: right outside the back is a smaller red-light area that I prefer to the main drag: it's more humane; a little more for the locals (although in recent years seems to have become less so). You'll find the beautiful Martine: star of the film "Ouwehoeren" there and many other more friendly ladies. If you cut across the shopping streets, you can get to the main red-light area for a wander round. Also to the back (west side) there are some very lovely streets with boutique shops including some nice art shops and cafes, etc: a very pleasant stroll for window shopping or people watching. One time there was an outdoor festival here: just on the canalside - it's the kind of thing that makes Amsterdam a special place and seems to happen quite often (maybe they do it just for me?) Again, more locally there is a gay cinema round the back of the hotel and some nice restaurants and a gay bar too ("Prik": the names are always amusing to us English speakers!). Also, there's a great music/nightclub just round the back called "Bitterzoet": again one of my favourites (if you're feeling young, fresh and funky, check it out). Back on the gay theme, just over the road is purportedly the largest dark-room in Europe..in the Cuckoos Nest: a gay cruise bar with a downstairs dark area, and for more cruising, there's a fun place on the main Damrak which is a cinema with a viewing/cruising area upstairs. They play loud banging music, so if you're bored and want to sit and watch gay porn with your ears pounded it's great. Finally, if you're really bored, you might be lucky enough to have one of the rooms overlooking one of the red-light windows; in which case you can while away any downtime watching what goes on: it's a fascinating sociological study, but not anywhere near as interesting as it might sound, but it does at least beat 24 hour CNN if you want a few hours inside. In summary: a very well connected, easy place to get to, in a prime location, at a reasonable price with clean, well-appointed rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a perfect weekend”
Reviews.Author: SouthamptonLynne
Reviews.Content: Bought as lucky dip on Lastminute.com but couldnt have been better - price, location and rooms. Easy walk from the station, good check in service, rooms pretty standard but had all that was needed inc very comfortable (double) bed with lovely pillows. Positive points - bought canal cruise tickets much cheaper at reception, full ice bucket provided on request, ability to log on to computer in reception, check in for flight home and email boarding passes to the reception for printing - all for free! Just walk across the road for access to all the night life - perfect for adults! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location right in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Francie v Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location with everything on walking distance. The rooms are small but efficient with an excellent bed and a nice bathroom. Breakfast was fine at a reasonable charge.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Justyna J Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is excellent, very close to all you need. Rooms were very clean and staff very helpful. Rooms are quite small but absolutely enough for two. The only thing was that bed was made of two separate single materaces which wasn't comfortlable. Over all great holet for affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: WALADD
Reviews.Content: Ideally placed in centre of this amazing city. We had a delux room which was fairly spacious, clean and modern. Reception staff really helpful, no problem giving us a full ice bucket to have with our own drinks that we'd got from local shop. Wifi included and free to use pc in reception with instructions for printing your boarding pass. Only warning would be about lift, says takes 6 -8 people and it got stuck with 6 of us! Would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good rooms for Solo travelers”
Reviews.Author: OriMarmari
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. the deluxe room is very good for solo traveler but too small for duo. breakfast was nice, WiFi was free and working. room is very clean. what else do you need for an Amsterdam 36 hours layover..

Reviews.Title: “Willie Wood,Durham,England”
Reviews.Author: David W Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel as a friend had stayed here in the past.It was excellent value for money at 202 euro in total for 3 nights.Rooms are on the small side but are well equipped and modern.The hotel was spotlessly clean and well positioned in Amsterdam Centrum so only a few minutes walk from all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value for money !!!”
Reviews.Author: Deepaultaylor
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend booked this hotel for four nights .this is our third year in Amsterdam.we were very happy especially for money we paid .we were alowed to check in early ,our room was clean and comfy with a real good shower and hotel was right in the centre of the city. We would def book this hotel again especially when my friends paid same money to stay in a hostel .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: milty908
Reviews.Content: Location can't be better. About 5-10 minute walk from the train station, and another 5-10 minute walk to Dam Square. In a quieter part of the city center with easy transportation right outside. Or better yet, rent a bike from the yellow bike store across the street for 14 euros a day including insurance and ride around Amsterdam. The city itself is very small and the ride to Museumplein or any other place you might want to visit is all within 10-20 minute bike ride. Rooms are small but pretty well laid out. Doesn't feel as small as it looks. Nice large bathroom helps, I think. Good shower pressure and nice comfy bed. There is a small red light district around the back of the hotel, but this is away from the main red light district so much less foot traffic and pretty much no noise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation, in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Ritchie C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, right in the middle of the city. Whatever reason for your visit to Amsterdam this hotel will be perfect. High quality rooms, and an amazing shower! Staff were extremely pleasant. Overall everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem!”
Reviews.Author: Mossy07
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel Feb 23rd for two nights and was pleasantly surprised considering how little we payed for the stay, stayed at the Eden Lancaster in October, expensive and dire! 5 mins stroll from the station and perfectly located for all the main tourist attractions. Arrived at 10.00am and although official check in was 3.00pm we were greeted warmly and were checked in quickly. Room on first floor at the front of the hotel, bigger than I expected, tastefully decorated and very clean (along with the rest of the hotel) Room was bright and airy, slight downside - two single beds pushed together to make a double and no vanity mirror at the dressing table, which was a bit of a pain, plugs for hairdryer/ghd's but no mirror! Plus point, fantastic shower! Trams pass by out front but not overly noisy and didn't hear them after midnight. Couple of good, reasonably priced (although Amsterdam is a very expensive place to holiday in) restaurants on the same road. Overall a perfectly located, modern, clean and friendly hotel, will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but quirky and cool”
Reviews.Author: mampara
Reviews.Content: My partner and I visited Amsterdam for 3 nights from the 21st feb. After looking at many hotels we decided on Westcord city Centre. Its great location is a short 5 min walk from Central station, so it was easy to locate when we arrived. It is also possible to walk to everything we wanted to see in Amsterdam from here. Ann Franks house is not too far away, it is close to Dam square and you can even walk to the Heineken Museum from here. Although it is on a main road our room was at the back of the hotel so we werent disturbed by outside noise. We arrived an hour before check in but were able to go straight to our room. The room itself was small and an odd shape but was nicely done out and had everything we needed for our short break. If you stay in a 3 star hotel in london this is on a par. The bathroom had a nice big shower but the glass door afforded no privacy as the frosted panel had a clear glass pattern in it and the door had a gap down the side even when shut. This was not a problem for us as a couple. However the soap in the shower was not replaced when it ran out. The bed was fairly soft in comparison to what we are used to, but we do favour a firm bed. The light switches are positioned in the headboard and flick on and off very easily - however if you take your key card out of the wall it cuts out the lights so it was not a problem for sleeping. Tea and coffee were provided but again these were not replaced. We did not pay for breakfast but being in the city there are plenty of places to eat close by. I would consider staying here again if i return to amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Clean, Value, Shame about certain staff”
Reviews.Author: Instinct_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel from January 2nd for 4 nights. The hotel is in a great location and easy to get to all the major points and attractions in Amsterdam. It is modern and chic, rooms are also designed in this way and are very clean. My compliments to the Housekeeping staff as they replenished and cleaned our room daily with the same high standard. We did not have breakfast i the hotel as there are some great places to grab breakfast in Amsterdam, however it did look appetising. The only problem i had was with the front desk staff, We arrived around 11am, and asked politely if we could check in, which to our delight was no problem. It just felt like the checkin was rushed, the gentleman explained the facilities so fast that i barely understood him. he also told us to come back later for any more info about the city? we had no opportunity to ask about anything else. One night we came back fairly late, around 1.30am and realised we had left our room key in the room therefore we couldnt enter the room. When i got to the front desk, i told the lady and she had an extremely degrading expression on her face, she asked me how many keys i have, when i told her i already had 2, she responded, 'well you cant have another as you already have 2', where does that leave me, sleeping on the street? eventually after re-explaining myself she issued us with a key. the whole experience was quite daunting and she was quite rude. Apart from several front desk staff, and the fact the bathroom was made of glass (which was cool but sometimes embarrasing) the hotel is good and if they can resolve these minor issues i would have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, convinient location, on the small side”
Reviews.Author: Palmz79
Reviews.Content: A group of couples stayed here in October and checking in wasnt too stressful but took longer than usual. The lobby was clean and tidy and the staff were helpful. Our room was small, cosy if you like but the bathroom is within a partially frosted glass partition within the room which is ok if you arent too worried about privacy, but dont think anyone shy or prudish should stay here. If you have heard or seen your partner on the loo before then fine, as the glass partition is not sealed so you can hear everything! Overall a clean reasonably price hotel in a very central location within easy walking distance of the station. We all had a fab weekend and no horror stories!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice but small”
Reviews.Author: rcorso
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel...we were allowed to check in early which was nice. We arrived by train and the hotel was 5-10 min comfortable walk. Location - very central.....great coffee across the road on corner. Rooms - small, strange trianle shape room...you had to squeeze past to get to the other side of the bed. Carpet goes right up the wall and the bathroom has glass for walls. But it was decorated in a modern theme and very clean. Nice comfy bed a good pressure in shower. Free wifi was a good bonus. Didn't have breakfast at the hotel as eating out was relativley cheap. I would recomend this hotel...nice, clean, affordable hotel. We had a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “A convenient one”
Reviews.Author: MrPercyLam
Reviews.Content: Considering all aspects I like its location the most. The hotel is at the heart of the city, not far away from everywhere, particularly with the access of tram (there's a tram station right outside the hotel). The environment was good - very clean and cosy. Free wi-fi was also available so young guys like me benefited a lot from it. Smoking was prohibited from the hotel, which was another plus of this accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “good location !”
Reviews.Author: samantha r
Reviews.Content: me and my partner stayed at the westcord hotel 7th feb 2012 ! the hotel was in good location close 2 central station and dam square . hotel was very modern , rooms wer small but comfertable . i would recomend this hotel as in walking distance of everything ,,, amsterdam was amazzziiinnngggg :) would stay at this hotel again . good value 4 money x

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AgaSzSz
Reviews.Content: We did not spend much time in our room as there was so much to explore in the city but location is great for many important attractions and it's very close to all night life. Hotel is clean and quiet and staff very friendly. Good price for Amsterdam as well.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip January 2012”
Reviews.Author: Kenneth1960
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located close to the Central Station. The staff were welcoming and it was good value for money though the double bedded room was very small. A better design/ layout could have made better use of the available space (free standing bed facing the wall a strange idea). Was travelling light thankfully as little space for storing luggage. Room only so no comment on breakfast. Lots of good coffee places near by (wandered over to the Jordaan) for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: MissF89
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed for 2 nights at Westcord and we were very pleasantly surprised. We were greeted by a lovely gentleman on arrival who sorted out our room promptly. He also answered the many questions we had to ask about Amsterdam throughout the duration of our stay. Both staff at the reception were excellent and very helpful. The hotel is very funky. The decor is gorgeous and the layout of the rooms gives a modern twist to the hotel. As soon as we arrived at the hotel we had already decided that we were definitely coming here again. As for the location, it was great. The central station is literally at the top of the road and is around 5 minutes walking distance. Across the road from the hotel are various coffee shops and restaurants. The hotel also issued us a map of Amsterdam which was extremely helpful. Our room matched the pictures shown on the hotel site so if you'd like to see pictures just browse their website and the various pictures shown on Tripadvisor. The hotel is well worth the money and I would definitely recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Smul64
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner just spent a lovely 3 night stay in Amsterdam and loved this hotel! All the staff we encountered were lovely and looked after us really well, answering any questions we had about the area! The rooms are lovely, very clean and modern. The bed is so comfortable & the bathroom was very cool... all glass including the door & sink! The thing we liked the most about the hotel is that they are very secure as you can only get in at nighttime with your room card & also need it to get into the lift, it is also very laid back as they don't seem to mind if you bring your own food or drink into the bedrooms. The location of the hotel is fantastic, about a 5 minute walk from Central Station and about another 5 minute walk into Dam Square. There was also tram stops right outside and I would recommend to get onto the tram to on a few minute journey to Leidsplein.. a fantastic area with some nice restaurants and we seen a great show in Boom Chicago! It's a lovely city to visit and great for shopping! :)

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Sofia12Littleborough
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the hotel from Friday 27th January for 2 days. The official check in time was 3pm but reception allowed us to check in at 10.30am as they already had a room ready. Having travelled on the fast train from Schipol airport, which took around 20 minutes, the hotel was a 5 minute walk from the central station of Amsterdam. Check in was fast and reception staff were very polite. The room was lovely and clean, tastefully decorated, but the highlight was the bed, one of the comfiest I have slept in! Memory foam mattress with comfy pillows. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel as it costs around 13 Euros, there are plenty of breakfast cafes in the area. The hotel is a 2 minute walk from Dam square and the shops are situated just across the road. I couldn't fault this hotel one bit and would strongly recommend it. Take a very thick coat as Amsterdam is FREEZING COLD!!! Even colder than the pennines!!

Reviews.Title: “Great design and location”
Reviews.Author: kyugay
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in april 2011. We liked the design of the room very much. It is great for couples. The room is not big, but smart arrangement of the furniture makes it possible to fit a table into the room. Furniture and everything in the bathroom are new and clean. Breakfast was not included, so we had it in our room with food that we bought in the supermarket, or went to numerous cafe and fast foods near the hotel. Location is excellent! It is easy to walk from and to the railway station, and close to the canals and red light district. I recommend this hotel for vacation or holiday in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good Spot”
Reviews.Author: RMCL18
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, great location, hopefully we will be back! I love Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: julie t
Reviews.Content: myself and friends stayed at this hotel and found it great value for money, hotel rooms and bathrooms are cool and funky, staff were very friendly and i cant fault this hotel 1 bit, i am returning the last weekend in march again and was delighted to get this hotel yet again, so all in all great hotel and location, roll on march!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a good value”
Reviews.Author: monkey24
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here the last week of Dec and felt that this hotel was in a great location. It's several blocks away from the train station, which was great in saving cash for a cab ride to the hotel. It is centraly located from the square and the ferry terminal.We were able to walk to most tourists attractions such as Anne Frank's house. As for the hotel itself, it was a good value. We had a superior room on the third room which was bigger than our friend's room on the 5th floor (they had a star room). Although the room is small in comparison to American standards, for a European room we had amble space. There was enough space to walk around the beds and have to lay out a 30in and 25 in suite case on the floor. There are a few things to note about the room: * Make sure you get a superior room. Our friends had a "star" room and that was small. Not even enough room to walk around the bed. * There is construction still going on and if you want to sleep in past 9am or take a nap during the day it can be very disruptive. Ask for a room higher up as I think the construction is on the 1st floor (but than again my friends on the 5th floor could here it as well). *The walls of the bathroom are made of glass with some frosted parts to allow for some privacy (although the one place you would want frosted wasn't.. the glass in front of the toliet had a badly placed swirl design.. akward). *Our bed wasn't a true full, but instead two twin beds pushed up together. Overall I was pleased with this hotel and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Dave B
Reviews.Content: This hotel met all our needs, good room, good service, nice breakfast and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague”
Reviews.Author: Ollie1979
Reviews.Content: First off, I don't write reviews as a rule, but this place was so bad that I felt compelled to. Don't honestly know how this place manages to survive with the service and cleanliness when there are other, better hotels in the area. Arrived on a Saturday afternoon at 1.30pm to be told that the room wasn't yet ready - fair enough I thought. I'd grab a coffee and return later. By 4pm, it still wasn't ready so i complained, asking for the manager and the receptionist was so rude to us saying "look, it's not ready... What do you want me to do about it?" The manager eventually came and we checked in - eventually at 4.40pm. Got to the room on the 3rd floor and it was at first glance, ok. But on closer inspection, we found used condom wrappers under the bed, smoking paraphernalia in a drawer and it hadn't been hoovered. The bed was lumpy and the ensuite left a lot to be desired. It had zero privacy with glass walls. The room was so hot too, with the non adjustable heating on full. The window would only open 1cm or so. Eventually left the hotel and explored the city.. Getting back to the hotel (which is in Amsterdams second redlight area which isn't as safe or secure as the main one) we went to the hotel bar. Beers are about Â£6 and wine Â£8... A complete rip off. We sat by the window and watched people going into the premises next door - which is a shameless gay cinema club, the sound of which can be heard whilst smoking outside the hotel, but more importantly, when you are in your room. Breakfast was very poor at â‚¬15, and served by obviously bored staff with obviously little regard for personal hygiene. Would I visit again?? Absolutely not. This hotel is not what it is hyped up to be. AVOID!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Jennylee2011
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was excellent. My friend and I stayed for 2 nights in November and found the room very comfortable. A lot of people are saying the rooms are small but everywhere in Amsterdam is the same! The hotel reception staff were helpful and friendly. The location is perfect, its close enough to central station and Dam Square that you can walk to most main attractions but there is a tram stop right outside if you wish to go further out. Its also very secure with you needing to use your room key to enter the building and access the lift. We stayed at the front of the hotel and didnt find it noisy at all. The room was spotless and we loved the carpeted walls! The beds were like memory foam matresses and we had a great sleep. The shower was also very good. The bathroom has frosted glass but if your going away on holiday with someone you cant really be bothered about the lack of privacy. We booked last minute to return to Amsterdam for New Year but this hotel was fully booked. The hotel we did stay in (which is far more expensive) wasnt as clean or as comfortable as the WestCord. We have high standards of Amsterdam hotels after staying here and wouldnt book anywhere else for our future visits. We are looking forward to booking in advance this time to stay for New Year 2012! I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, small but fantastic non-smoking accommodations-- we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: debbiesdreamtrips
Reviews.Content: After an exhaustive search for a clean, comfortable hotel in a great central location in Amsterdam, I found the WestCord City Centre Hotel and took a chance. It paid off bigtime because it was one of the hotels my husband and I loved most on our European getaway in May 2011. True to European form, the room was small and would be difficult for those with loads of luggage. But we only had two dufflebags, so it worked great for us! Even with the room being small, it had a smart layout-- the foot of the bed was pressed up against the wall under the wall-mounted tv, with the desk placed just behind the headboard. Hard to picture? Just check out the photos I included with this post and you will see what I mean. It was really neat! :-) I travel a ton for work and have become a bit of a hotel snob over the years-- accommodations that are very clean, super comfy, and a little on the luxurious side are important to me, and yet I don't like to spend a lot of money on a hotel stay either. It makes for a tough combination to find such accommodations in Europe but I feel that this hotel fit the bill! The shower was one of the BEST we had on the trip-- a seemingly limitless supply of hot water and the water pressure was excellent! Really nice. The only thing I will say is that the toilet was really close to the shower stall and sink, so I can imagine it would be difficult for really heavy-set people or the elderly who don't get around too well-- for us, it wasn't a problem at all though. The glass windows were a unique touch in the bathroom but might be a little awkward for people sharing a room that are super modest or don't know each other as well. That said, they have it perfectly glazed in all the right spots, so the most someone will see of you is your feet and, if you are tall, maybe the top of your head-- otherwise, you are covered. It does make you feel a little exposed though since I suppose someone "could" see you if they squatted down and peered under the glazed part (through the clear part of the glass) while you were showering or using the toilet. If you travel with weirdos who you think might do that though, I'd recommend re-thinking your travel companions! HA! Again, this wasn't an issue for us as a longtime married couple, but something I thought I should mention. The bed was super comfy and the room temp quite comfortable. We were there in late May when it was still cool outside, so I can't speak for how it might be in the dead of summer, but the room temp was great during our stay. The location of the hotel was soooo ideal and my husband even commented that he really appreciated that I found a hotel in Amsterdam with such a great location. We felt safe there even when walking around at night and it was fantastic to be in walking distance of all of the main sites and in close walking distance to the bus/rail station. Really awesome! We also had some great pastry shops in the area for breakfast and there is no shortage of great little cafes and restaurants close by (and throughout Amsterdam) for lunch and dinner. The biggest issue for me in Amsterdam was the rank smell of reefer that is everywhere in that city, but Amsterdam has that reputation for a reason so I expected it. I was just grateful that our non-smoking room didn't have that smell or any hint of cigarette smoke-- I was definitely happy about that and it lent to the nice stay we had, for sure. :-) If you are looking for comfort, cleanliness, a nice hot shower with good water pressure, a comfy bed, non-smoking rooms, a great location in walking distance to the main attractions, and a good price, this is the hotel for you. If you plan to bring loads of luggage though, there won't be room, but most savvy European travelers know better than that anyway. Just pack three or four outfits and do laundry half-way through the trip and keep your load light and you'll have a MUCH better travel experience. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Could Improve”
Reviews.Author: Angad1111
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel from January 2nd for 4 nights. The hotel is in a great location and easy to get to all the major points and attractions in Amsterdam. It is modern and chic, rooms are also designed in this way and are very clean. My compliments to the Housekeeping staff as they replenished and cleaned our room daily with the same high standard. We did not have breakfast i the hotel as there are some great places to grab breakfast in Amsterdam, however it did look appetising. The only problem i had was with the front desk staff, We arrived around 11am, and asked politely if we could check in, which to our delight was no problem. It just felt like the checkin was rushed, the gentleman explained the facilities so fast that i barely understood him. he also told us to come back later for any more info about the city? we had no opportunity to ask about anything else. One night we came back fairly late, around 1.30am and realised we had left our room key in the room therefore we couldnt enter the room. When i got to the front desk, i told the lady and she had an extremely degrading expression on her face, she asked me how many keys i have, when i told her i already had 2, she responded, 'well you cant have another as you already have 2', where does that leave me, sleeping on the street? eventually after re-explaining myself she issued us with a key. the whole experience was quite daunting and she was quite rude. Apart from several front desk staff, the hotel is good and if they can resolve these minor issues i would have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Cosy room....Shame about the building works!”
Reviews.Author: Stuart K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights as a mini Honeymoon. It was located close to the Central Station and all attractions. The staff were very pleasant and helpful with any problems we had especially when our safe stopped working! The room it self was small but not cramped just cosy. There was a lovely soft double bed, tv and a desk with tea making facilities. As previous people have said, the bathroom has a translucent and in some parts transparent wall, so you'd want to be close to the person you're staying with, at the same time the bathroom was clean and stylish. The only reason I didn't rate this as excellent is there are some building works going on which were noisy but they are considerate enough to confine it to daytime hours when most of the time we were out and about. Lovely place in a lovely city. Will visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: CaptainOfKnowledge
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 5 days. Highly recommended. 1. Internet available everywhere in the hotel, works perfect. 2. Rooms are a bit small, but excellent design and very clean. Very quiet. Safe box with code lock available. 3. Breakfast not recommended because its too expensive and you can eat at many places around the hotel. 4. Excellent location, 5' walk to the Dam square, 10 minutes from the central station. 5. Hotel staff were very kind and helpful, for every request we had. We will definitely return to this hotel on our next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “It is not a bad hotel but toilet could have more privacy”
Reviews.Author: MyTasteHisTaste
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night, we did not mind that the room is small, we were expected to be out meeting friends and not staying in the room all the time. The bathroom has semi transparent/translucent (swinging) glass door which might not be suitable for non couple sharing the room. There is not much privacy when you need to go for the real "business". We stayed at a street facing room on level 3, street noises level were manageable. The double bed feels smaller than a queen size bed. One fault in their room design is the light switches at the bed headboard, the pillow or sleeping arms can easily switch the light on/off when you are in the bed. We had to extend and stay another night and the only room available was the single bed room which I thought was quite good if you were sleeping there alone. We paid an unreasonable price for the second night because it was the new year's eve weekend and we decided to spend another night in Amsterdam at the very last minute. If we had the time to look around, wouldn't pay Euro140 for the single bedroom but the previous night of Euro80 for a double bedroom was quite a good price. We will return to stay in this hotel if we get good rate again but not more than Euro100.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good”
Reviews.Author: Geert-Hilde
Reviews.Content: I stayed in worse hotels that were much more expensive in Amsterdam. I can recommend this hotel for people who really like to be close to the main attractions. The cosy â€˜Jordanâ€™ district is just around the corner, the Dam 5â€™ walking, idem for the red light district. Tram stop just in front of the hotel. Yes the room was very small, but clean and with a very nice design bathroom. Service is professional, but breakfast to expensive and not good.

Reviews.Title: “You would be happy if you're prepared to see a small room...”
Reviews.Author: CKJANICE
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, the room is really really small, if you are prepared to see a very small room but it has got everything you need also you expect to sleep right next to your roommate even you book a twin room, then you should be happy with this hotel... clean room, free WIFI, transit is right in front, city centraal station is within 5 minutes walk, many places to eat and see...

Reviews.Title: “Good value, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: LCBriz
Reviews.Content: Just read previous review and they are correct to say that renovations are going on currently which makes the room very noisy during the day. Overall, my experience staying in the hotel for 2 nights is that it is still very pleasant and good value. when I arrived, the gentlemen at front desk allowed me to check in early which I was very grateful for. Some hotels charge extra for this service. He also acknowledged that there were renovations going on and apologized for the inconvenience. He also asked if I preferred a quiet room or one with a view. I chose the quiet room which was on third floor. It was indeed very quiet except for when the renovations where happening which seemed to be from late morning to around 6pm. If your out most of the day, you probably don't even notice the noise. The room was very clean and spacious. Shower always had hot water. The housekeeping lady who I bumped into a couple of times was very polite and cheery and when I told her it wasn't necessary to clean my room, she was thoughtful to ask if I had enough clean towels. The only thing that I felt might have been missing was a fridge/mini bar, but I didn't expect this for a 3 star hotel. I paid 70-80â‚¬ a night and felt I got great value. Location was Rey convenient to Amsterdam centraal station and to all the shops / dam square. If I am in Amsterdam again, I would definitely choose to stay at westcord again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Room”
Reviews.Author: KatieAQ
Reviews.Content: Great hotel but was on top floor and all we constantly heard was the flag/flag pole vibrating/jiggling around, very noisy. Also construction going on which prevented nice quiet mornings. Talked to different front desk staff and they really sidnt care! Sorry to say I WOULD NOT stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: BRIAN K
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel as part of a trip to Holland. We had never visited Amsterdam before and we were very pleased by the location of this hotel, only a brief walk from the station. It is so close to many of the main tourist attractions and there are plenty of restaurants and bars just a stroll away. The room was small but very comfortable and spotlessly clean. We found the reception staff to be efficent and extremely courteous throughout our stay. We were also pleased with the security- having to use the key card to enter the building, lifts and stairs at night. We would recommend this hotel to friends and family and would definitely book it again for future visits to this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the City Centre”
Reviews.Author: BDeMaert
Reviews.Content: If you visit Amsterdam you usually don't spend a lot of time in your hotel room, basically the only time you spent there is to sleep and have a shower and to relax after a long day of walking around the city. For all of those items a room at the WestCord is perfect. The rooms are small, but offers all needed amenities. They are clean and well kept. If you do however travel with someone else than your partner then the bathroom can be lacking a bit of privacy. Reception at the hotel was correct, friendly and helpful. However I did find the price of breakfast a bit expensive, but never fear because just across the road there's a small coffee shop offering a good cup of java and bagels for your breakfast - and a fraction of the cost. Overall this hotel offered what is was saying it was offering. A definite hotel to be staying at again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: misskay314
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for an overnight stay in Amsterdam. Like most hotels in Europe, the rooms are very small. Even for two people, it was quite tough to get around the room. (2 people and 2 luggages) However, the beds were very comfortable. - This is what you need after a long day of walking around the city. The furniture is modern yet cozy. I did notice the stench from the closet. I placed my computer bag inside, and when I left I could still smell it. The bathroom is clean and modern. - Only problem is that the drain seems to clog up.... Everything is within walking distance. The Central Station where you can take the train to and from the airport is a 10 min walk. Anne Frank's house, Red Light District, Dam Square and other cafes/restaurants are all within 10-15 min walk from the hotel. If I was to come back to Amsterdam, I will def book again with WestCord.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: CMMN
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean room in a perfect location. Very close to central station - within walking distance. I would defo recommend this hotel and stay here if i were to return to Amsterdam. Staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A pathetic Experience”
Reviews.Author: Bhupendraa
Reviews.Content: On my return journey I thought of spending a night at this city centre hotel which was highy rated by my booking site and sounded good. The most horrible experience was there while entering the room itself where there was a table (for reading since it had table lamp) in front of the door followed by a small and shaky bed and then the end of the room with no space left on the footside of the bed. Bathroom was almost a part of the room and you always felt uneasy about it. I have never experienced such a kind of room and the only way out was to spend as much time in the city centre lanes. The property is quite old and needs extensive rennovation. The restaurent is very basic and it is better to buy things from outside and make your breakfast. The location of the hotel is also not ideal. Hotel staff is not friendly and treat guests in an indfferent manner. I have nothing good to say about this property and felt relieved while checking out...

Reviews.Title: “Hotel westcord”
Reviews.Author: Jjcktaylor2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Amsterdam a few times this hotel is clean and in a good location, had to pay a service charge checking out which wasn't said when booking overall good hotel can't smoke in the room tho would stay hear again

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: s_ramsam
Reviews.Content: This is a compact hotel in an excellent location in Amsterdam. I chose this hotel for a stay of two nights mainly based on the other reviews in tripadvisor and my experience was rather similar. Close to the Centraal station and Dam Square, with a tram stop opposite and several eating and shopping places close by, the location is the main advantage of this hotel. The check in process was smooth and friendly. Room size was ok for one person and so were the bathroom facilities. A coffee maker is provided which is convenient. I did not try the breakfast at the hotel. The pricing of the room seemed to be a bit on the high side for a non-refundable room without breakfast for the duration of my stay. I also found lot of a variation in the pricing between different dates so if one has a flexible schedule on could go in for the dates the offering best prices. The hotel could have some more brochures about Amsterdam tourist attractions to assist the visitor to the city.

Reviews.Title: “location and the rest... forget about it!”
Reviews.Author: HF852
Reviews.Content: I'm being very GENEROUS here to give a 2 stars rating seriously, and its PURELY for the location only. Got recommanded from a friend who stayed in their other hotel a bit further from the city centre earlier this year. Checked their photos with the rooms which look clean and modern, thought the price was fair and paid 468 euros for our 3 nights stay in October. Upon arrival and saw the real room we got--> SHOCKING! A total false advertising... Okay, we've chosen to book the "standard comfort" type rooms, but we surely did not expect to stay in an "entirely different world" from most of the other hotel guests. The room is so tiny, with stinky old carpets and old bathrooms like a 2-stars drive in motel. Nothing is close to their pictures shown online, not even their NON superior room but standard room photos. There was this huge crack on the shower head which means there was like a water stream shooting out in another direction, flooding the bathroom everytime after a shower. Worse thing is yes, we got a room not facing the streets so we didn't have the noise problem, but then its like sleeping in a public toliet every night because of the smell coming out from the pipes running down probably from all the other rooms near the courtyard. We asked the reception if we can PAY and upgrade to another room immediately, and was told the hotel was fully booked. Checked the next night again and was told they could not quote a price for us unless we packed up and checkout the following afternoon and tried to check-in again...we had no time to risk with the price so we did not upgrade at last. There were no where what so ever mentioned on their website by paying like 10 or 20 euro less from their SUPERIOR room means u have to stay on their STILL RENORVATING dodgy first floor. Finally, talking about service, the towels never got changed until asked, we did the usual by putting the used towels away and NOT on the racks -->meaning they would like to be changed, all we found when we got back was a pile of dirty towels chucked on the bathtop... we have to called the reception or bumped onto one of the housekeepings to get clean towels... I know most people said good reviews about this hotel and thats how I chose to book with them initially, but I definitely DID NOT had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good or Excellent - worth the extra vote to Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: traveller3471
Reviews.Content: Okay, so this is not a five star hotel, but for the price I paid this hotel definitely deserves an Excellent rating. Why? Location This was my first visit to Amsterdam so I had no clue where anything was (I had limited time to do proper research). This hotel is PERFECT, it is a maximum 10 minute walk to the Central Station that takes you to the airport (and has a great bike rental place, I forget the name but it's the one right at the end of the station (to the right as you are facing it - look for the red bikes!). If you walk down one of the main roads from Central station it is very seedy and loud, but the road that this hotel was on was much quieter, with a few places to grab breafast. It was at least â‚¬12 for breakfast at the hotel so we didn't bother with this - although the restaurant area looked perfectly nice. Amsterdam is such a small city that I strongly recommend hiring bikes to see the whole city in one day. I wasn't that keen at first but was so glad my friends thought to do it. Everywhere is flat and there are huge cycle lanes so you can avoid traffic. Ah I remember, Mac's bikes - they were really smooth to ride, I was surprised how little effort it took to zoom around. Other than that you can walk EVERWHERE, we walked from the hotel down to Anne Frank's house. From the hotel to the markets, the red light district etc etc. The Room The room was compact and as other people have said has a very different design. But that doesn't make it bad! I loved it, it was very modern, very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. As for the bathroom, the walls are indeed made of glass, with a frosted strip going around the middle. So you can't see the person inside the bathroom unless you stand really close and peer over the strip on your tip toes. However, I don't think I would have been too happy to use the toilet etc with anyone other than my partner. The Service Check in was a breeze and when we checked out in the morning we were given receipts for our luggage and they were kept in an office until we were ready to leave Amsterdam. A great visit and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Returned here several times...”
Reviews.Author: simonjasonparker
Reviews.Content: Just a quick review... my wife and I have stayed in a number of hotels across Amsterdam and have finally settled on this one for extended weekends away. It's nicely, centrally located with all amenities and attractions in easy distance... but also sufficiently removed from them. The hotel staff have always been friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but packed with everything you need and thoughtfully laid out to get the best out of the space. It's nicely modernised, although you may love or hate the bathroom patterned glass walls, and glass sink. Regardless... its in a great location, its always been quiet enough for us (especially after some horror story hotels we've stayed in there!!)... a great base to work out of !! Highly recommended at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Alright Hotel..”
Reviews.Author: jd82
Reviews.Content: Westcord city center was an alright hotel. Nothing to brag about, especially the service. I was served by this guy with slicked back black hair, i wish I had remembered his name, it was something that sounded Mediterranean, anyway long story short, he wasnt very friendly to anyone. If you're reading this, get a new job. The room itself was very small, but its Europe so you can expect it, the shower leaked onto the floor too. The location however is pretty good, right across the street is a road that leads right into the center of Amsterdam. I walked to the Ann Frank house as well, took about 20 minutes. To sum it up, you're only using the hotel to sleep in so in a way I cant complain but if you do a little more searching than I did you're bound to find a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice comfortable and convenient place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Veterinaru
Reviews.Content: The hotel room that we stayed in (401) was very clean and modern with a comfortable bed, very stylish & contemporary (without view to the street). Very friendly staff, great location close to any interest place in Amsterdam (400 m from Central station, 20 m to tram/bus stop, 5-10 min to Dam square, Red light district etc.). I will definitely stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location and good service, but pretty funky room design.”
Reviews.Author: TokyoCC
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that I accidentally booked this hotel. I thought I booked at another hotel, but I apparently had too many screens open and booked at the hotel I was trying NOT to choose. Despite that, I had a nice stay at the WestCord. The location is great...a short walk from everything! Not a walker? Not a problem. The tram stop is right outside the hotel, as are countless restaurants, bars, and shops. Overall, the room was clean and pretty comfortable, but the layout was just a bit weird with the headboard in the middle of the room and your feet touching the wall while in bed - the exact OPPOSITE of the way a bed should be set up. Then, there was the glass-walled bathroom that would probably be more than a bit awkward if you were traveling with someone other than your spouse. Still, I went to Amsterdam to see the sites and enjoy the culture, not to sit in my room all day. This hotel more than met my needs, and I would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Only design”
Reviews.Author: RobertVPrague
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in October. Location is great, no noise from the street as we had room on the 5th floor, also the hotel itself is very calm. Only thing we didnÂ´t like was the design of the room, which is not very comfortable. For example: no hooks in bathroom missing proper doors to bathroom no wardrobe, only 3 shelfs with bad access contrariwise position of the bed writing desk is too big compared to size of the room Also very annoying was leaking water from the shower. Didnt try the breakfest, for eating can recommend italian restaurant Ponte Vecchio or sushi Genroku (all you can eat) For shorter stay it is good hotel but as we stayed in many hotels in Amsterdam, next time I choose another one.

Reviews.Title: “Only worth staying in a Star room on 4th or 5th floor”
Reviews.Author: susie1964
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is all about the location which is fabulous. Price is reasonable considering prices for Amsterdam. The rooms are all clean and the breakfast is good, but the only rooms worth staying in are the Star rooms on the 4th or 5th floor. Stay in any of the others at your peril you have been warned!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: bfarrell
Reviews.Content: Small room but v clean. Funky glass door on bathroom, excellent location in city centre. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is best thing about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leannealawi
Reviews.Content: Me n my boyfriend stayed here at weekend and it was reasonable price for Amsterdam but very poor quality of room we just booked a standard room but Wat they don't tell you on here is that if you don't book a deluxe room you get put on the 1st floor which is very very noisy and old fashioned not like the photos you see on here !!! It was small but we wasn't bothered bout size that was least of problems there was holes in the curtains and sewage smell came from the sink after you ran water !!! Sorry to put down this hotel as the deluxe rooms are probably great but we had already paid Â£330 for 3 nights and wen we went down to asked to be moved he simply said we could move but they are all the same unless you book deluxe room you will be put on 1st floor and we couldn't afford to upgrde this is wen we realised the photos we had seen were of the dearer deluxe rooms so just be careful wen booking

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous room”
Reviews.Author: DianeNSW
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying in this hotel and are very happy with the room, location and staff. After all the differing reviews we read on these rooms I am very pleasantly surprised. Our room is a deluxe twin room no 517. It is an unusual design as you have the foot of the beds touching a carpeted wall on the foot end. The TV is on that wall so nice and close to view from bed. The bathroom is a nice size compared to many hotels I have been in lately. The walls are frosted glass, no lock on the door. I can understand people who are not a couple finding this a little less private than a solid wall but it is still adequate for privacy. A hair dryer is supplied in the bathroom. There is a desk and chair behind the head of the bed (again unusual) with phone, two power outlets, drawers with tea and coffee making facilities inside. Good size robe with safe. The window opens to let in fresh air, we have no view but that is fine and also means absolutely no street noise. There is a choice of street or back of building, we chose back for peace and quiet. The beds are two singles made up separately but pushed together. I do not know if a non couple can get beds apart. They are very comfortable and lovely and clean with two pillows. The room has air conditioner which we have used almost constantly - also have an opening window for fresh air. Good block out curtains. There is room to put two good size suitcases on the floor if you work out the best location for ease of moving around the room. This room has been perfect for us, it isn't the largest room we have had but I would say it is as good as we have had for appointments. The Hotel has a nice lounge area downstairs if you feel the room is small. There is an elevator which cannot be accessed without a room card. The location is just about as central as you could get. We paid 104 Euros including taxes and feel this is good value, would pay up to 130.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you can”
Reviews.Author: David G
Reviews.Content: I almost wrote this review immediately after my wife and I checked in to this hotel. Besides the central location in Amsterdam, there were no redeeming qualities at the hotel. We started out by being given 2 twin beds and when I went down right away to change rooms I was told there were none even though I reserved this room months ago. I then called downstairs to ask for extra pillows because I have a bad back and was then greeted by the staff with half the pillows I asked for and was told "this is all you can have." There is no air conditioning in the room so if you are used to AC then don't stay there. Later on the first day, we went to the front desk to see if we can buy a bottle of wine and they said they don't have any. The TV was small and only had 1 English channel. My wife and I are really not complainers but staying there was just so awful. We didn't receive a warm welcome and I believe the man that brought our bags up to the room (who is also the maintenance person) was under the influence of marijuana. I went to take a shower to only find out the removable shower head was broken and wouldn't stay up. I called and when they sent up the maintenance guy he basically balanced the shower head so it appeared to work and as soon as I turned it on later that night it fell to the ground and I was forced to shower with one hand and hold the shower head with the other. They said they would come back the next day to fix it and never showed. To make a long story short, I wouldn't suggest this place to my worst enemy and I hope the hotel owners read this review.

Reviews.Title: “Good and convenient place to be”
Reviews.Author: RahulAgrawal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a good location, about 5 mins walk from centrall station. All areas like dam square, damrak were few mins walk only. Van Gogh was about 20 mins walk. The rooms were nice and clean and very modern. The bathroom doors did not have locks so little problem with kids. The room is small but cozy. The property overall was nice. There is a grocery store about 3-4 mins walk in the opposite direction of the central station called Albert Heijn so it was good to buy fruits and bread and milk. Any small place around the hotel would cost twice as much.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: peepeep
Reviews.Content: If you are a tourist in Amsterdam, this hotel is perfect for you. It is walking distance to everything----train station, red light district, the canal, restaurants. The rooms are VERY small, but new, modern and well appointed. It offers free wifi in the rooms and free coffee in the lobby. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: luvthebeach44
Reviews.Content: my husband and I stayed here in august for 2 nights,it was kinda pricey but everything is during the summer in amsterdam is.I was pleasantly surprised when we got there,the staff was nice and the room was quite new and very clean! The shower is very tiny and does fill up in minutes as others have said. You cant beat the location here,it was close to everything,we pretty much walked everywhere, Central station is right down the block as well so catching the train is super easy!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Tania P
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel using Booking.com - stayed for 2 nights. Yes the rooms are a little small, but you do not go away to sit in your room. They are fine for the purpose. Great location, 5 min walk from central station (once you figure out which exit to take!) Didn't have breakfast as it is a little pricey, like most hotels. Plenty of places to eat around the hotel. Dam Square is just around the corner. The only negative was being woken up by maintenance man, asking us to close the window as something was being done outside and he didn't want water to get in. Thought banging on the door was a bit heavy handed. A phone call from reception would have done the job All in all, great hotel, great location, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for a 3 stars hotel! and excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Lara_M1
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with hotel, the location was fantastic. It's a close walk to everything, museums, restaurants, bars, canal tours etc. and most importantly 5 mins walk from the main train station ( which is only 10 mins by train from the airport!) Originally, i was worried about staying in a 3 stars hotel, but it was a very pleasant stay. The rooms although small , were clean, with all your typical facilities ( kettle , tea and coffee, safe, air con/heating etc), the hotel was very quiet ( even though our room was facing the main road). And the staff were helpful. My only comment would be as a non smoking room, we often returned to it to find it did smell of cigarettes, i guess it was particularly noticable after you have been outside. So i guess that's one thing which could be improved.

Reviews.Title: “So small”
Reviews.Author: SirEdthe1st
Reviews.Content: The rooms are the smallest I have seen. A small double bed with the a tiny bathroom only separated by a part frosted piece of glass. Location good and staff friendly - but I can't get past the uncomfortable sleep from the small bed.

Reviews.Title: “Central, clean and cosy”
Reviews.Author: RachSan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in a deluxe suite, very nice hotel, rooms very small and the bed was too but it was very clean and great value. There is a tram stop out the front of hotel which is very convenient but most of the attractions are so close by, you could just walk.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: JustmeinUK2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the WestCord City Centre Hotel (room 113) on the 8-9 September and am dissapointed with the room. There were multiple red stains on the brown partition that separates the room from the wash basin, stains on the bed, the curtains couldn't be closed properly leaving at least a 3 inches gap and causing us to have a restless night's sleep from the lights shining in from the street, there were cobwebs at the ceiling, the safe was broken, there was no soap in the soap dispenser at the wash basin and there were multiple stains on the carpet. We booked the room online after seeing that it is a 3 star hotel and from some of the good reviews written for the hotel. I am deeply dissapointed that our room was not at the standard expected, despite paying Euros 191.50 (excluding city tax) for a night's stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - good room (bit noisy)”
Reviews.Author: fozzie14
Reviews.Content: Cannot believe how easy it was to find this hotel from Amsterdam Central Station (5 min walk). Was in an ideal place. Dam square down the road, the city centre, very convenient for coming back to in the day or evening to use facilities or change shoes! plenty of shops, restaurants and cafes very close by. Small lanes to investigate. Good rooms, very clean, coffee and tea facilities, TV, nice to sit at the window and people watch, helpful staff. Breakfast expensive though at 12.50 euros each!! went to cafe over road instead for hot chocolate and Panini. I would recommend this to anyone really. Best to get a deal on a website though as it was 139 euros per night otherwise. Could get noisy with trams, other traffic and people banging their door shut - but got used to it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Siobhan V
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Westcord 27-29th August 2011. Great hotel. Location: The hotel is in a perfect location. Tram stop right outside and under 5-minutes to get into the Red Light district / Dam Square / Train station. At the same time, the hotel was on a lovely street and very quite. I would not recommend the shop to the right of the hotel when leaving (not associated with Westcord) as it cost â‚¬20 for deodorant, an adaptor plug and some moisturiser! Hotel decor/ interiors: Very pleasant. The room was an adequate size for a City visit, and considering how much we paid, we were very pleased. We paid â‚¬200 for 2 nights in a delux-room and have no complaints. There were a good selection of English channels on the TV and the room was very nicely decorated. Staff: The staff were very kind and helpful towards us. They provided maps and plenty of tourist information and were very attentive. Security seemed very good- having to check your key into the entrance and lift past a certain time of night and a Safe was provided in the rooms. In summary, I would 100% stay at this hotel again. Brilliant location, value for money and a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location!”
Reviews.Author: stpMike
Reviews.Content: Was at Amsterdam for 3 days and loved the location of Westcord as it within walking distances from the Centraal Station and attractions nearby. Cafes and bars are also located nearby, so you won't go hungry anytime. There is also a tram stop opposite the hotel, which makes travelling convenient to places such as Museumplein when your are not in the mood for a walk. Got an early check-in at 12pm too! Downside is the room size (bed, shower cubicle and WC) could be too small for some. Good: location, pricing Not so good: room size could be too small for some travellers

Reviews.Title: “close to central station”
Reviews.Author: monymontana
Reviews.Content: the hotel is close to central station few minutes walking and it is in a parallel road to the ain central road to the left, rooms are not very big as most of the hotels there.just a tip the hotel is situated kind of inside of an extension of the red light district( but it is not located in red light district ) so expect to see in the opposite building some windows with red neon lights :)

Reviews.Title: “A very nice comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SOMELIKEITHOT47
Reviews.Content: It was the first time me and my partner visited Amsterdam so was not to sure about were to stay (did not want to stay anywhere seedy) so after a lot of searching the nett we enderd up booking the hotel westcord in advance prier to arrival And when we arrived at the hotel we was very happy with how choice the hotel room that we stayed in was very clean and modern with a comfortable bed and warm surroundings the bath room was partitioned with modern glazed glass with some stars cut out of the glazed areas very stylish & contemporary but nice..! which was not a problem for me & my partner but might be for two strangers or friends shairing a room..? We both enjoyed how stay at the hotel and would definitely stay there again in the future very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Bronbach
Reviews.Content: Lovely modern hotel. Great location. Easy walking distance from station. Very close to Grachtengordel. Good cafes nearby for breakfast, especially liked places on the corner of Singel and Brouwersgracht canals. Tram stops right outside hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room yet worth the stay!”
Reviews.Author: subterranean1981
Reviews.Content: Yes, the room is tiny (deluxe room). When we first came in to the room, we were surprised by the size of it (as it looked bigger in the photos when we made our booking). Good that the bed still fit my boyfriend (who is 198 CMs) Yet, the room has a great location, something that we were looking for. Other than that, the hotel is completely smoking free and clean. Bathroom is spacious enough (note: the bathroom is with glass wall, so will only recommend the place for those travelling with their partners)

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service?”
Reviews.Author: Chase D
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located and convenient to De Kolk Parking if you have a car. However, the woman who checked us in at the Reception staff was very unfriendly (almost rude). The Reception area and rooms are small and dark (very little lighting). Windows in the room have a view to an enclosed wall perhaps just to provide some light. We had two rooms on two different floors and the hallways had a musty smell. The mattress on our bed provided little support. The small bathroom however appeared clean. Overall very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel with a good location”
Reviews.Author: doron71
Reviews.Content: Great location near the dam & central station, the only down side was that we ordered twin beds & we received a double bed with two mattresses at the reception they told us that this is there twin...

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but Great!”
Reviews.Author: JayBeeDerbys_England
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel & had a great time. The young man on reception was very friendly & helpful when we checked in & offered us either an inside room which would be quieter but no view or a room facing the street which had a better view but noisier. We chose the street view & although a little noisy, mainly from the trams, it didn't bother us & we slept well since the beds are really comfy.
