I'd already read previous reviews so the quirky design didn't come as a shock & I've nothing really to add to what's already been said but our room was spotlessly clean & having booked a deluxe room the free Wifi & AirCon was much appreciated as the night we arrived it was particularly hot & humid so the A/C cooled the room nicely for sleeping. We didn't take breakfast in the hotel even though it was on special offer at 12.50 euros. That was still expensive & there are plenty of good little restaurants on the doorstep offering excellent breakfasts, lunches & dinners to suit all tastes. This hotel is ideally situated to visit all the main attractions & we thoroughly enjoyed our stay & wouldn't hesitate at staying here again should we return to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “A well-located and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: notbornyesterday
Reviews.Content: Our six-night stay at the Westcord City Centre was quite enjoyable. The hotel is very well located downtown, a five minute walk to the Central rail station, less to the heart of the action, Dam Square, and about 12 minutes to the Anne Frank house. The area is much quieter than Damrak (the main street), and safe. The hotel itself is clean and modern. We were greeted by a clerk who was very helpful. Although it was only 9 am, we had our choice of several rooms, facing either the street or the tiny courtyard. The room was small by North American standards, but we were only sleeping there, so that was fine. Much has been made of the glass bathroom door, but our room's configuration made it less awkward. We did not use the hotel's breakfast, opting instead for fruit and croissants bought from nearby stores the night prior. The bed was excellent. We were not suffering jet lag, but slept for well over our usual because the bed was so good. The day prior to leaving, a huge shipment of new beds arrived and were being installed. All in all, this is a good hotel, with good value. It's not the cheapest, but a three star hotel in this area at the prices we paid was a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: klaijawala
Reviews.Content: Amazingly central, clean and with a cheerful and helpful fron desk. The rooms are tiny but its a great place to stay. The front desk even sells passes for the trams. It's very close to a lot of great restaurants and bars!

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice!”
Reviews.Author: Cristi_Ionescu
Reviews.Content: Location: The hotel is situated very convenient to all attractions, 5 minutes walking from the Central Station and 5-7 minutes away from Dam Square, with a tram stop just in front of it. Probably the best way coming from Schiphol Airport is by train, however as it was a rainy day and traffic jam, I took a taxi and cost me about EUR 50. Reception guys: Very friendly and polite, asked me whether Iâ€™d like a street view room. There is a computer with internet access. Room (mine 513). Initially the room looked quite funny, but I got used to it very fast â€“ please refer to the attached pictures as they speak for themselves. The bed is situates normally, but the pillows are there where your feet supposed to be and the LCD TV is hung on the wall above where your head suppose to be. The floor is covered with a back-red carpet which continues on the LCD TV wall up to the ceiling. Vey interesting, indeed. The room is pretty clean. The bathroom is delimited inside the room by two half sandblasted wall glasses. Inside the bathroom the shower walls are also made of glass and the sink, too. The toilet is somehow tight between shower wall and bathroom wall. Although I understood it is a non-smoking hotel, sometimes it came some smoke from other rooms through the ventilation system. Breakfast: Next to the reception there is the breakfast area having a very modern design. Breakfast has plenty to offer from different types of cheese, salami, milk and cereals, eggs, small sausages, coffee and juices, pastries. No complains and moreover it is not the same food every morning, but they diversify it from one day to another. When checking-inn donâ€™t forget to ask for the breakfast vouchers as youâ€™ll be asked for it every morning. One TV screen shows the status of flight at Schiphol airport, but I noticed data only in Dutch. Attractions: Donâ€™t want to spend too much time as Amsterdamâ€™s attractions are very well presented on internet, just wanted to flag that a day visit to Delft is really a must (one hour by train). Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel, Excellent location, Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: blaenau2000
Reviews.Content: The Comfort rooms are very comfy with modern decorations, Only 5 min walk from Central Station, I travel often to amsterdam and the Westcord City Centre hotel is always top of my list, close to Damrak, Red Light, Coffee Shops, infact theres a Bulldog round the corner and Grasshopper and Amnesia too. Staff are always friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: Kattmat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights with my boyfriend. The girl at the reception was a bit stressed when we arrived, we were 3 hours early but they had a room that we could get immediatley so that was nice. The glasswalls to the bathroom didn't bother us, they are frosted so you won't see a thing. Very nice decorated room, with free wi-fi and great view to the street behind the hotel. Would definatley recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy rooms well designed , excellent location”
Reviews.Author: candevoyat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 nights at the hotel on our way back from Cuba to Athens . We had booked in advance and had chosen this hotel for its location and what we considered good value for our money . We have stayed in a number of hotels arround the world 5 to 3 stars and what we appreciated in this one was the fact that the designer due to the lack of space had taken advantage of every little part of the room . As far as we were concerned we had made the right choice as this was our first time to Amsterdam and the location gave us easy access to everywhere we would like to go . One of the facilities we appreciated was the fact that they kept our luggage in storage as our flight back home was an evening one and we were given the chance to see more of Amsterdam during our last day there .

Reviews.Title: “very small bed, problem in glass wall of bathroom, but clean room”
Reviews.Author: sally2934
Reviews.Content: After reviewing tripadvisor opiniions, I have made reservatation of this hotel and returned yesterday. Though there were several differences from my expectations, overall the hotel was okay especially with no emotional conflict which becomes maybe more important in remembering on hotel. However, the room itself was different from expectation on several points, as follows. <Weak points> 1. Very small twin beds : It was really twin beds, though the two beds are stick together and each bed size was much smaller than single bed, The width of one bed though I didn't measure, seems to be less than 80 centimemters. Combined two bed sizes seems to be just same as one double bed size. The room itself is very small. 2. Glass walls of bath room : Though it is coated glass walls, it is not completely coated. The bath room walls, just 50 centimeter away from the twin bed, are made of glass, through which inside of bathroom are seen. This can be very embarrassing unless one person stays. Sitting on the toilet tub can be also seen from outside of bathroom through the glass, which is most embarrassing. It can be embarrassing even it is couple. I had to use the bathroom with no light in darkness to minimize the problem. 3. No refrigerator : It maybe my mistatke that I didn't check about this. I just assmed there would be small refrigerator, but there wasn't. Instead, there was coffee pot. Without it, it is inconvenient to drink cool water and to store some food for days. (I know from past experiences, in European countries, many hotel rooms didn't have refrigerator.) 4. Poor cleaning : Though the beds are clean and neat, I could see dust as it is on the desk, bed top, and bathroom sink. The sink in the bathroom is of glass and modern, so it looked very clean at apprearance, but sitting on the toilet tub, due to its closeness, you could see the dust as it is on the sink. Overall room facilities are modern and clean, but cleaning was poor. 5. Card to operate the lift : Security was good so that you should first activate the lift by room card. However, the card was not well recognized so I had to try at least several times, inserting and pulling. <Good points> 1. Location : The locations is between central station and dam square. By walking from central station, 10 minutes distance. From central stations, you have to cross streets for trams, cars, bikes, canals, rather complex surroundings to arrive the street of hotel. Then it takes 5 minutes from the hotel street. Near dam square, there was very good food market and also Anne Frank house was nearby. 2. Coffee pot : This was actually very useful. Not only coffee but soups, you could have only with this. Coffee and teas were always provided kindly. 3. Wifi : (Though we chose this hotel due to this, we didn't use in fact.) 4. Others : Airconditioning was proper and overall the room was clean with modern interior and not noisy. The hotel staff was kind in letting us borrow a dish and knife.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience!”
Reviews.Author: Mimmaa
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent a night in a double room at this hotel. We booked 2 weeks in advanced and due to our late flight we checked in late (around 11 PM) and we've got the worst room in the hotel since it we were the last guests!!!! The room was on the first floor, very dark with a window facing a very tiny space (less than 1sq meter) between the hotel walls that I guess was supposed to be a light passage. The room was carpeted with an ugly, dark, dirty and old carpet which was disgusting to walk on with bare feet! The room was sort of smelly, which I think it was because of the carpet. The mattresses were old and deformed and the shower glass was broken and came out everytime we tried to open or close it. In general we didn't have a good feeling staying there and we didn't stay there the second night although we already paid for it and it was nonrefundable! We asked if they can wave the city tax for the first night instead and they even refused to wave the city tax! In general it was too pricy for such a dated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: June080
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night only, and that was enough! The room, although designated a 'deluke' room, was VERY small and the bathroom was simply a corner of the room partitioned off with a glass screen which left nothing to the imagination!! For very intimate couples only! I dread to think what the standard rooms are like! Not to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Theft?”
Reviews.Author: Disgruntled015
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had an OK stay until my pyjamas went missing...not only did the staff member then not apologise for the inconvenience but did not act on their intention to call me to let me know if they had been found in the laundry. I therefore had to email the hotel and they didnâ€™t reply. Only after a second email did they reply that they regret to inform me that my pyjamas had not been found. No apology. I therefore asked if they would offer any compensation. â€˜Unfortunatelyâ€™ they could not. Again, no apology. Surely, this is tantamount to theft?

Reviews.Title: “Great location shame about the customer service & facilities!!”
Reviews.Author: JaseandJules
Reviews.Content: Having arrived in Amsterdam early on Tuesday they had no problem looking after our luggage in locked facility until we could check in. Check in ok later that day (check in time 3pm). On first impression rooms are very modern and clean. Then when we had a shower later that's when it started to fall apart. You had to turn the shower off every couple of minutes to let the water drain away or it flooded the bathroom (see photos), at the same time I called to the reception to see if I could use the iron which they told me was located on the 1st floor. I went down & found no iron! I then phoned reception for them to say it was broken! Still not happy with the fact I heard it was broken I went to talk to reception and was told it had been broken yesterday and enquired if they would be replacing as I would like to be able to iron my clothes before going out tomorrow evening for a meal. The guy on reception said it wouldn't be replaced & I quote said "it is what it is". For the price off this hotel I would not expect that sort of customer service. On the plus side it's only a 5min walk from Amsterdam Central station and free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Super Central Hotel, Safe, Great Staff....”
Reviews.Author: CardiffCityChick
Reviews.Content: 5min walk from Station!! Very safe hotel...Cards to get into hotel, lifts, rooms...etc Clean and very moderm. Staff were very friendly, Would def recommend hotel and would stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: Flavianahf
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent central city hotel, 5 minutes walking from the Central Station and close to everything. It has a modern and beautiful design, a very confortable bed and great shower. I liked the tea/coffee facilities available in the room. We had a pleasant stay there. I strongly recommend it and would stay there again should I return to Amsterdam. The only thing that could be a problem is the bathroom that does not provide much privacy since it is enclosed by the frosted glass. It could be a problem for friends sharing a room.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off at the westcord”
Reviews.Author: RV9412
Reviews.Content: Arrived on the day of reservation and requested a cot. Was told 1) room was to small for a cot, 2) we should have reserved a cot, 3) there are problems with the fire dept inspecting and saying we have to many people per room, and 4) we should never have relied on a third party website to make our booking. ----- states; "1 older child(-ren) or adult(s) are charged 50 euros per night , per person, for extra beds. Extra beds are available on request." There is nothing stating the need to reserve these cots in advance., and everything leading the unsuspecting tourist to believe merely asking for a cot is all that is needed to get a cot. This is a classic bait and switch operation.I urge one and all to avoid this hotel. We were refused any money back and paid 614 euros for nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Claudine1020
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! The location is perfect, especially if you are visiting Amsterdam for the 1st time. It's literally 5 minutes walk from everything, Dam Sq, Red Light District, Centraal Station. The staff are so pleasant and helpful and will really go above and beyond to help you out, whether that be giving directions or helping you get to grips with the trams. Nothing was too much to ask of them. The hotel is very security conscious and your key is needed to access lifts at all times and to get in the front door at nighttimes. It may seem expensive for being officially a three star, but it really should be rated higher and it is definitly worth the price! The rooms are spotlessly clean and luxuriously comfortable. Our room was facing out to the main street and we never once heard any noise from outside. I wish I had got the name of the receptionist who checked us in as he was extremly helpful and patient with us because I would love to give him a special thanks. Cant wait to stay here again in November!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Cornelia38
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 3 day stay in the Westcord City Hotel (26-29 June) and i can honestly say there is not 1 bad thing to report about this hotel. Location wise you couldnt get better. It is less than a ten minute walk from Centraal Station. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from bars, restaurants and shopping. Dam Square was no more than 10 minutes away. The hotel itself was lovely. From the moment we arrived the staff couldnt have been nicer or more helpful. Our hotel room (317) was stylish, modern and quirky. Beds were very comfortable. Glass en-suite was beautiful and the shower was great. There was a hair dryer, kettle and safe that was free to use. No more was needed to be honest. This was our 1st time in Amsterdam but we plan to go back in November and we will def be staying in the Westcord City Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent prices, great AC”
Reviews.Author: SanderM
Reviews.Content: I am sure that the bathrooms have already been covered in many reviews, don't expect privacy. We are a married couple so I was ok with it. WiFi was free and that was great. The rooms are modern and clean. About the only room in Europe which offers a coffee maker, meaning you have a water boiler and instant coffee, but early in the morning you won't hear me complain. The AC worked great, and you can open the windows, which is very helpful when your room fills up with the pot-smoke from your neighbors. Not sure how this was possible, but it happened one time, and that was about the only negative. The hotel can't really do anything about that in Amsterdam. The beds were absolutely great, got the best sleep of all our time in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and nice room”
Reviews.Author: einmal75
Reviews.Content: Rooms are pricey for the category, but that 's a general Amsterdam thing I think so We stayed with a friend for a week end in the city Rembrandt there. The twin room space is..really optimized, every cm2 is well used. Room is clean no doubt. Location is just perfect, a 5/10 minutes walk to the central station and the main shopping street of the city just around the corner, very convenient. Staff was friendly and very helpful to get some insights of the city. We didnt opt for the breakfast as they are so many good cafes in the area.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING location!!!”
Reviews.Author: traveler20000_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for $116/night (unbeatable price in Europe). It was walking distance to everything that we wanted to see. I highly suggest that you upgrade to the Deluxe room. Great value!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern decor”
Reviews.Author: web2las
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in May at the WestCord City Centre Hotel in Amsterdam and were very pleased with the location. It was convenient to the train station and within walking distance to major sites. The modernist decor was clever and made a tiny room seem much larger. There was coffee in the room and we bought breakfast items at a nearby grocery to avoid the pricey breakfast. We'd stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location and Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lump Inc
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and loved our stay. The room was very comfortable, clean and well decorated. We really liked staying at this property. (Very cozy) It was conveniently located in the middle of everything and we were in walking distance to all the main attractions. We loved Amsterdam! Just a tip....be careful with the taxi drivers. The going rate, we found out after the fact, is about $8.00 EUROS. We didn't realize that the hotel was so close to the train station, and the taxi driver charged us $15.00 EUROS, much higher than the standard rate,,,,so basically he ripped us off...live and learn! Other than that, great experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient hotel for a few nights stay”
Reviews.Author: Pinarcan
Reviews.Content: Located very close to the train station and Dam Square. Dont expect much of the rooms because they are tiny but the decoration is very modern and nice. Mind the clear glass walls and door of the bathroom that kills privacy (and romance!) but overall great little place

Reviews.Title: “Briiliant”
Reviews.Author: Geocamper
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, great service. Easy to find. Funky rooms, good lounge area. They didn't mind us using their lounge for a big chunk of the day after we checked out with a hangover and used their wifi for hours on end. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Soundsandwich
Reviews.Content: We had room 601 from May 4th to May 10th and were indeed very pleased with the hotel! Immaculately clean, helpful staff, perfect location. Also, it has two lifts as opposed to many of the charming, but very old hotels with steep and narrow stairs. The only thing to mention would be the positioning of the light switches. It was too easy to accidentally bump into the light switches during the night as they are right behind the pillows. The water boiler and selection of tea/coffee were much appreciated. Only 5 min. walk to Centraal Station which takes you straight to the airport. 5 min. walk to De Wallen, Chinatown and Damplein. Great value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “A good base to see Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: kittiwake67
Reviews.Content: We would recommend this hotel as a base to see Amsterdam, not as one in which to spend a lot of time. It is convenient for the station and the centre of the city with lots of restaurants nearby. The rooms are small but comfortable and clean - a little quirky eg the bed faced the wall (and the TV) and the walls were carpeted. The furniture was clear, but comfortable, and the frosted glass on the shower room a definite minus point. The glass sink was spotless, until the first use after which it looked awful. Trams pass the door but with the window closed, you hear nothing. Staff friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “good location but disappointed with some of the employees”
Reviews.Author: tabiti
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean and quiet room, the glass bath is interesting but sometimes embarrassing and the sink ( also glass) dangerous. In the last day we have to wake up at four o'clock a.m.so I asked the receptionist for wake up and also for package breakfast. At 11 p.m., the receptionist phone in the room and said that he is alone in the reception and can not prepare the package breakfast. I understand that, but that we was not awake without explanation and without apology, I find it rude and impolite .

Reviews.Title: “DON'T BOOK THIS HOTEL, AS THEY TAKE YOUR BOOKING AND CANCEL AT THE LAST MINUTE”
Reviews.Author: Samatha-D
Reviews.Content: I booked back in December this hotel and was looking to staying from this Friday. On Saturday I got and email to stay they could not accomodate us and have arranged to go to the Art hotel in Amstedam some 1.7 miles from Dam Square. My husband can't walk very far and that is why we booked hotel. We booked what we wanted not where they wanted us to go. We have had to cancel our flights and now lost Â£250 because of it. Very disappointed of the way we have been treated.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: DKHNL
Reviews.Content: With just one night in Amsterdam, I wanted a hotel not too far from the Central Station. I find that I like to stay in the city than out by the airport even if it's for just one short night. If you stay out by the airport there are few options for eating other than the hotel and there is nothing to do. The city center is a short and easy 20 minute train ride. I reserved a single room. The room itself was very tiny with a single bed, but tastefully furnished, modern and comfortable. I was given a deluxe room that came with free wireless, kettle with tea and instant coffee and a very modern bathroom. The bathroom was glassed in with the lower parts frosted. Since it was a single room, privacy wasn't an issue. The sink was made of glass. Not really liking single beds, I have to admit that it was very comfortable and I slept very well. The room is air conditioned, but I didn't need it. My room faced a quiet street, but it would be nice to have the a/c in the summer when the weather does get warmer. I was asked if I wanted to pre-purchase breakfast when I checked in, but I opted against it. If you are a breakfast eater, it will save you money if your pre-purchase breakfast. I had an early flight and left the hotel at 6:30. I made a cup of coffee and headed to the train station. The hotel is a 5-10 minute walk to Central Station, close to shopping and lots of restaurants. The hotel is just around the corner to one of the smaller red-light areas, but totally safe. The hotel is close to a large Albert Heijn Supermarket as well as a smaller one. It's a great place to get drinks, sandwiches, snacks, and souvenirs. There a large number of restaurants close by including a number of middle eastern fast food places where you can get a delicious shawarma. You will need your key to get into the hotel in the evening and to operate the elevators. I liked the added security, but never felt uncomfortable walking around the neighborhood. There are always people around.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: IrinaManchester
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel.My sister and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay here in Marrch 2011.The hotel is situated 5 min walk from the central station,rooms are very clean,newly modernised,quite compact but good for the price you pay.All the Staff in the hotel were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Bijou, Bright & Brilliant Location!”
Reviews.Author: millyweeble
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were greeted warmly and were given lots of valuable information, especially that parking is very expensive in Amsterdam. We were advised to park at the Ajax stadium and get the train back into the centre - we did and it worked out a lot cheaper and wasn't too much hassle. The hotel is nice enough, we stayed at the WestCord Art Hotel last time, but this hotel made up for a lower star rating by being so central - Train Station, shopping, bars/restaurants all within easy walking distance!

Reviews.Title: “Best small room”
Reviews.Author: mkrajacic
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nicely situated in the center, very close to Central station. There is a number of bars, restaurants and coffee shops very close, although we preffered the southern, more quiet part of Amsterdam. Rooms are very small, but very nice with a monoblock of bed and desk and 2 lamps. However, the light swithces are not so smartly placed, so it can happen that in the middle of the night you switch on the lights...Also, the bathroom has glass walls which are tinted, so you might get less privacy then you would want. Restaurant is quite nice, and the staff is helpfull and kind. You can leave your baggage in a small room in the lobby also after you check out.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location,Location”
Reviews.Author: Linda M
Reviews.Content: As the title suggest the location is the key here! Let me start by saying if I am on a city break the hotel is used for sleeping and showering! I wouldnâ€™t be one to spend hours reading, watching TV, or surfing the net in my room. If you are one that does then this hotel (or this room!) wouldnâ€™t suit you. The room we were allocated was very small, I had booked a standard twin as a friend and I were travelling. The room was very very small with two rather narrow single beds pushed together, the pillows were more cushion like than pillows, however it was still comfortable. We had a small bathroom with sliding door, bath & super powerful shower just the thing to wake you up in the morning, no frosted windows as described in previous posts. We were given a room at the back of the hotel, when the window was open it was noisey but when closed I couldnt hear a thing! The foyer and halls were clean and tidy and while the dÃ©cor is a little outdated in the bed room we were allocated. The staff were polite and friendly and they gave us a map of the city and how to get where with what tram or train, we walked everywhere though. Also there was free wifi in the hotel that came in really hand when we used our iphone to map out our next destination. I canâ€™t comment on the food here as I didnâ€™t have breakfast there is a bakery up the road where I got croissants - come out of the hotel and go right - and a juice bar on your next right! This hotel is very close to Seasons restaurant, its two/three blocks at the back of the hotel, I would most definitely recommend Seasons it was fantastic, but thatâ€™s a whole other review! I donâ€™t know if I would stay here again or suggest this hotel, purely because of the price. They would need to re-evaluate their pricing structure for their smaller rooms. On a location note, then I would suggest you stay here but be prepared for small living arrangements!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super service.”
Reviews.Author: MemberNems
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the base for our weekend in Amsterdam. It really is very central, which would usually mean that it is noisy at night, but it wasn't at all. The rooms were fine, not huge, but perfectly adequate. The foyer is modern and the staff were so helpful, pointing us in the right direction for anything we needed. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel, but it worked out well to go in search of good pancakes, which Amsterdam has in abundance! The staff set this hotel apart. They were really great. Our friend bought a really lovely bottle of wine, which we wanted to drink in the hotel. the rooms are a little small for four, so we asked if we could drink it in the foyer and there was no problem at all. They gave us a corkscrew and four wine glasses. Above and beyond the call of duty. On our last morning there, we discovered how close we were to some of the red light district, (with some red light booths in the same block as the hotel) but it wasn't an issue at all. Great service and very central location for all the sights in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and great Location”
Reviews.Author: jmckeag
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed a three night break at The Wescord. To be honest after ready the reviews I was a bit worried about what to expect. We arrived early in the morning and the staff were very friendly and helful, they took their time to show us a map of the City and point out everywhere we wanted to visit. We had booked a deluxe double room, yes it was small but very modern, great comfy bed and flat screen TV. The bathroom has frosted glass but it was spacious, clean and modern. The reception of the hotel is large airy and comfortable. The staff are very friendly and helpful nothing was too much trouble. The location of the Hotel is fabulous, 5 minutes from the Station, a short stroll to Dam Square and all the attractions ie The Red Light District, Anne Franks, madame Tussaudes and the Dungeons. If I had to pick one downside to the Westcord it would be the breakfast. To be honest at fifteen euros it is overpriced and the little cafes across the street would be better value. I would most definately stay at this hotel again and have already recommended it to friends, please dont be put off by bad reviews, you just cant please everyone, but the Wescord certaintly tries.

Reviews.Title: “dump avoid at all cost”
Reviews.Author: suzy_from_dublin
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a visit to Amsterdam ,We have been a few times before and never had a bad experience with any hotel we stayed in , But this was a disaster .When we arrived all went well with checking in .We went to our room there was delux on the door so we were delighted thinking it would be fab,only to get a shock /the room was tiny rectangler shape there was no main light in the room only two lights on the headboard there was no bedroom room lockers either . the bed would be fine if you were a child but it was tiny for a double bed the mattress kept falling off the bed there was only a small duvet for two of us,But the best is yet to come the bathroom was frosted half way up fine but there was a design on the glass which meant you were looking at the toilet .Who wants to look at somebody on the toilet even a basis hostel would not have that. The Breakfast was very basis tin fruit cornflakes bread the hot water machine was broke so we had to wait till more was boiled .I would never stay here again because it is only one step ahead of a hostel,The only thing going for it , its location

Reviews.Title: “A bad and lasting impression.”
Reviews.Author: worldisabook
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 9 days including Thanksgiving week in Paris, Venice, Rome and ending the last night in Amsterdam. After re-reading the reviews here, I had to double check to make sure we stayed at the same hotel everyone else was talking about. Yes, it was the Westcord City Centre but we didnâ€™t get the rooms pictured or described here. We only stayed here because it was down the street from Centraal station and we had an early morning flight to catch. It was also close to dam square and all the shopping. It really is a very good central location. Many trams stop a few feet from the entrance and will take you everywhere in the city. Luggage storage was available which was great since we arrived around 10AM. Free wi-fi was also available. The reception staff was friendly and helpful. Good security â€“we were provided with a card to open the front door and to use the elevator/lift after hours. Despite our room location, it was pretty quiet at night. Unfortunately, those were about the only good things going for this hotel during our stay. The lobby is modern and nice but the room we had was in dire need of a major overhaul and remodeling. Our room (on the 3rd floor) which looked out into the main street, looked totally different from the pictures others posted here. I guess we were downgraded to their older rooms since we didnâ€™t have the flat screen and the much talked about frosted glass bathroom. The bathroom was extremely small with the sink on the outside. Furniture was dated with 2 single mattresses pushed together. The carpet was dark and even in its dark hue, you can see the stains. There were stains on the wall too. There were things on the bath tub that we did not even want to take a shower that night. I felt the need to sanitize everything twice with Lysol wipes. It was like staying at a really cheap, dirty motel. At least, the bedding looked clean enough to sleep on. We had stayed at much more spacious, cleaner rooms with better amenities for lower prices in Italy the previous week. We definitely would NOT go back to this place as Iâ€™m sure there are other and better options. The state of our room left a bad and lasting impression on our last night in Europe. Thank goodness we only stayed here for 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Really good place near the station”
Reviews.Author: lordlel
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. Hip and modern, very good. Staff really nice, hotel clean. Rooms very small and modern, but hey, why spend your life in a hotel room. Very central, waliking distance to just about everywhere in central Amsterdam. Hotel will hold your bags fo free which is sweet. Breakfast as usual with hotels is a rip-off, but across the road there are a host of options. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL - EVEN BETTER LOCATION !”
Reviews.Author: CityLiving90
Reviews.Content: We approached this hotel after having a terrible experience at a nearby hostel. Immediately it felt like we were in heaven by comparison! There are both standard rooms and deluxe rooms (twin and triples available). The deluxe rooms are very nice and have a great decoration. There is also free wired (ethernet) internet in the deluxe rooms. The Wi-Fi was not free though. The en-suite's in the deluxe rooms are a bit odd as there is a glass door... bit awkward if you're sitting on the toilet!! Nice and clean bathroom and shower so I can live with this minor ningle. The best bit about this place is the location. Literally minutes walk from Damrak, the Red Light District, and best of all, it's just 4 minutes down the street from Centraal Station. I will definately stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THE WESTCORD”
Reviews.Author: DontStayAtWestCord
Reviews.Content: *WARNING -- DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL This hotel is a nightmare. We stayed at the WestCord City Centre Hotel for one miserable, sleepless night (original reservation for 3 nights), booking through hotels.com. The room the hotel gave us was disgusting - the carpet had dozens of unidentifiable filthy stains, the bathroom was moldy and dirty, and there was a repetitive, constant noise coming from somewhere outside the paper-thin walls of our room, which we believe originated from the elevator. And we're not referring to the little dinging noise that lets you know the elevator has arrived. We're talking about a shrill, roaring, squealing and creaking noise of the elevator moving in the shaft. We weren't even next door to the elevator. We complained to the front desk and they offered to transfer us to another room down the hall that was even worse. The hotel staff also pretended the hotel did not have severe noise problems, even after another guest overheard our story, and said she too was bothered by the horrible creaking noises in her room. The best part was the hotel staff blamed the noise on the construction going on next door, which we (luckily) did not hear. Best wishes to those guests who had to deal with that, too. We consulted with the Front Office Manager Yoeri Spruyt and were told that that we would be refunded the 2 nights of the reservation so we thought it would be all right to go ahead and check out. When we arrived back home, we called the hotel to confirm our refund, and spoke with Yoeri who quickly transferred us to his irrational and irate manager, Shai. Shai angrily informed us that we would not be refunded our money under any circumstances. He and Yoeri lied and said Yoeri never stated we would be refunded, which statements we relied on in checking out. These lies resulted in us paying for two hotels the rest of our stay (the one we transferred to in addition to the filthy, noisy WestCord). And at the very least, if they had told us we were not getting our money back (which they absolutely did not) and we still made the decision to leave after not being able to locate a room without noise, we never would have told them we were checking out early -- why should this hotel receive the windfall of being able to rebook the room AND not return our money?! After arguing for 15 minutes, we told him that weâ€™d make sure to write a review with an accurate account of our awful experience at this hotel and its customer "service" and he threatened to sue us (no joke!). If you have a choice of hotels, Iâ€™d recommend the NH Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky. Itâ€™s similarly priced and located down the street at Dam Square (across from the Royal Palace). The rooms are clean and quiet, and the staff friendly, accommodating and honest. We had an awesome time there!! Thankfully we did not let our experience with the unsanitary and unsatisfactory WestCord and its unethical staff ruin our trip!

Reviews.Title: “location above all”
Reviews.Author: roadster76
Reviews.Content: I was at the west cord just for one night,It's really a good choice if you want a modern and design hotel that it's not expensive.The deluxe double room I got assigned after a quick check in process was on the second floor; as read from the previous reviews the room was not that big, there is no space to place your luggage, if you are travelling with big ones i'm sure you have to climb over it to get in the bed or bathroom.I was travelling alone and with just a cabin luggage so it was not an issue.The decor of the room was modern, work desk, coffee and tea making facilities, lcd tv and a safe box; it had not much of a view overlooking the hotel's inner courtyard. The bathroom, with the famous-unfamous glass door (that is not completely clear), was also quite small and had a shower.Wifi connection in the room and public areas is free, there is also a computer at the lobby that can be used for free.Did not have breakfast at the hotel, it was priced 15 Euros. I went to a place close by, but payed for a full american breakfast with coffee and fresh orange juice the same price as the hotel's one. But I guess there are other choices, it also depends if you're looking for a plain continental breakfast.The hotel's location is really good, it is located between central station and dam square, but it's out from the hustle and bustle area.I really suggest this hotel for a week end in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Comfy room and great location”
Reviews.Author: black_miccia
Reviews.Content: Like what others mentioned in the previous review, this hotel has a great location. Only 5 minutes to Dam center, 5 minutes to red light district and pretty much close to everywhere. Easy access with trem, bus and taxi outside of the hotel. The room was small with modern design, but had a cozy ambient in it. Bathroom was more suitable for a couple because of the glass door. The shower was great with a strong water pressure. The bed was comfortable, the sheet was clean and changed everyday. The headboard was a little but dusty but the rest of the room was very clean. Even though we were staying in the room with a street view but at night it was quite. So we had no problem to have a good night sleep. We didn't have our breakfast in the hotel because of the choices outside of the hotel were better with less price. Don't be surprise with the "strange" smell in the lift and corridor. With red light district only one step ahead, there were people who prefer to enjoyed it at the hotel room. One minus thing was the female receptionist were not as friendly as the male receptionist. They did our checked out without any hotelier attitude. No smile and not even one question about how was our stay. I can understand if it was hectic in the lobby but it wasn't. I hope they will have trainings for improve they service and their attitude towards guest. Well, overall it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ade1234
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a perfect location for exploring this beautiful city. As all previous reviews state its only a short walk to pretty much anywhere (Dam sq, RLD, Anne Frank etc etc) so makes it ideal for a short city break. Hotel itself was clean and the staff very friendly when asking for anything. Room was usual size for a euro hotel, bed was mega comfy especially after a 'trip' to a coffeeshop (!!) and yes the bathroom is a glass box but this was considered a novelty and certainly didnt put me or my partner off. Overall a great little hotel and will now become my preferred choice whenever I visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A poor hotel which has see through bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: Jcp744
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in late October 2010 for 1 night Arrived at hotel around 12 noon, and was able to drop bags off, were told to come back after 3pm when we could check in. We were asked if we would like to pre-order breakfast at 15 euros, but kindly declined as the pub next to the hotel were doing breakfast at 8 euros per person. Got back to the hotel around 3:30pm and we were allocated a room on the 5th floor, this is when the problems began with this hotel. We booked this hotel through expedia which clearly stated it was a twin room. But the room was a non-separable double bed frame, with 2 single mattresses on top. I spoke to reception but they said the room was a twin room. I told them this was not a twin room, as I have stayed in other hotels with twin rooms, and told them they have 2 separate beds in them, but the staff didnâ€™t seem to be bothered. The next major problem in this room was the bathroom, what was this hotel company thinking? Clear glass with some frosted glass mid-way up. Again this created problems, as when one person was in the bathroom, it was a little unpleasant to be able to hear everything and have to turn your gaze in another direction when the person you have booked the hotel room with was taking care of business in the bathroom. The hotel wifi was beyond a joke. I went down to reception to query this problem, as I was trying to check in for a flight, but the airline website would take an eternity to load. The member of staff on reception said this about it â€œThis is a 3 star hotel, next time book a 4 star hotel.â€� I found this comment to be ridiculous, as if you are going to provide a service provide a proper one, or just direct the hotel resident to a local internet cafÃ© instead of being rude and flippant about it. The hotel beds were very soft, managed to get a decent amount of sleep, but were grateful I was only spending 1 night in this room. I found the room to be very small and what an estate agent would probably describe as â€œcompactâ€� hardly an room at all for 2 occupants. Coming downstairs in the hotel in the morning I was greeted to stains of vomit (at 09:45) â€“ surely the hotel could clean this up bearing in mind there was only 2 lifts in this hotel and the stairs seemed to be very popular. Went to the local pub for breakfast (forget the name) and on way back I am glad I did as I had a quick look to see what the hotel was serving for breakfast, and it didnâ€™t look inspiring. Overall, would I stay at this hotel again? NO! for Â£100 a night its not like I am booking into a budget hotel, and polite staff would go a long way, decent internet connections would be ideal, as I found myself going to an internet cafÃ©. And for staff to make sure stairs are clean would be good (vomit stains are not what I call a good impression). So to sum up, I wouldnâ€™t stay here again as I donâ€™t like people seeing what I am doing in the bathroom, staff speaking to guests in a rude manner and having to avoid vomit stains on stairs and sleeping in a box room, I donâ€™t recommend this hotel for the money they charge for a room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in heart of city”
Reviews.Author: i-Luv-Travelgd
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this spot. Room was spacious by Amsterdam standards. Staff were very helpful and located right in the centre if town, short walk from central station. Great desk to work from, tea & coffee facilities in room also. I believe some rooms are smaller so you may like to ask for a larger room. Beware that bathroom is not very private. We liked the bathroom but two friends may find it a little exposed. Great spot to explore Amsterdam & it's surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Everything nice, except the bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: fromstockholm1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel in October, and I really liked a lot about it. The reception was very kind (there was a fine gentleman who speaks spanish, our mother tongue), and always ready to help. We travelled with our baby, so the elevator and the lack of stairs in the entrance meant a lot to us. The room was in the 4th floor and was really silent. It was a tiny room though, but enough for the three of us. The only thing that annoyed us was the lack of privacy of the toilet. That glass door was hideous and I donÂ´t know why they decided to do it like that. The shower was great, the cleaning of the room was excellent, etc. The location is great, you can walk everywhere or take the tram. But that damned bathroom door was just awful!!

Reviews.Title: “Superbly comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Aced_up
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel I booked room 306. Room is very compact but very cosy. I had a lovely sleep every night I was there. Bathroom/toilet is cool...simply a glass unit/room within the room. Glass sink too. Breakfast is EUR15, a bit pricey although it is an all you can eat / drink. Staff are friendly I cannot fault it. I was not disturbed at all. Very nice

Reviews.Title: “Not for couples who don't know each other very well.”
Reviews.Author: hornpeak
Reviews.Content: The location is great and Ssaff is incredibly friendly and helpful. The rooms themselves are very small and oddly designed, though. I didn't have a problem with the carpeted wall, but I found that the desk/headboard was annoying and I kept inadvertently switching overhead lights on when I adjusted my pillow. The bathroom was, umm, not for everyone. The only thing separating it from the sleeping area is a thin glass wall. However, the shower was spacious, clean and had great water pressure. Its not for everyone, but for people who don't plan to spend much time in their room, it would be just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel, but great value.”
Reviews.Author: Panda2010_10
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny, but it did have a full service bathroom. Great location with walking distance to many sights. The bed was soft ..... but too soft. The staff was friendly and helpful in providing maps, toiletry items that were forgotten, and sending postcards home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location, would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: jbell_79
Reviews.Content: We have recently stayed for 3 nights at Westcord, and found the location to be fantastic. Less than 5 min walk to train staion, and stones throw from Dam Square. 10 mins walk to Red Light. Cafes, restuarants and coffee shops all need by. Everything is within easy walking distance. The room was modern and clean. Small, but you would be hard pressed to find anything bigger for the price. Bathroom was less than private (frosted glass walls) and might be an issue for new couples, or friends sharing a room. The buffet breakfast was great VFM, and good quality. Hot options changed daily. Staff were helpful and friendly, room was cleaned each day. Wireless in each room, or free use of internet in foyer. We would definitely stay here again. It was nice coming back to the room at the end of each day.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for couples I'm sure... but a bit too cramped + intimate for sharing with a friend”
Reviews.Author: Red_Three
Reviews.Content: I spent a saturday night here with a travelling companion before moving on to Den Haag. My previous stays in amsterdam were in a B&B style place in rembrandt sq and a hostel in prinsengraht, which were both good. First impressions- excellent location, 5 mins walk from amsterdam central station, right along a main tram line- so easy access to the rest of the city. The hotel lobby itself was very stylish, staff were polite & considerate. This was costing us ~130 euros for a twin room deluxe per night- so i did expect it to be much nicer than the previous places i'd been in. The room however was a bit of a let down- since we were on a corner- our room was a weird L shape which made it seem quite cramped- bear in mind that we went for a deluxe and not a standard room. The decor itself was very nice, modern fittings + small flat screen on the wall. Now my 2 biggest complaints about the room was firstly the bed- our twin room consisted of 2 VERY small single mattresses side by side (we actually had to call reception to check this was a twin room). The other complaint was that they had opted for a glass door for the bathroom. Now part of the glass was tinted- but considering this is NOT a room for couples- someone should have realised that possibly you don't want to see your friends showering or sitting on the toilet?!?! (am i a prude???) In summary- excellent location, fancy decor. But the deluxe room didn't seem amazing value for money and felt cramped and the bathroom situation left quite a lot to be desired..... So not recommended for mates travelling together, but for couples i'm sure it ticks all the boxes!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant hotel very comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: gj_owen
Reviews.Content: We arrived at about 11.30am and were allowed to check into our room - The staff were very friendly and informed us of the city tax that we would have to pay on departure. We were given the offer of a room facing the street or one inside the hotel - We chose inside the hotel, (room 206) we didnt have a view but there was no noise from the street - (although the street the hotel is on isnt that busy anyway) The room is small but cosy, I was travelling with my girlfriend so wasnt a problem for us. The beds are very comfortable and the pillows even more so!! The bathroom can cause problems for those of a shy disposition but ultimately didnt affect our trip (you can always ask your partner is wait outside!) The room was lovely, hairdryer, towels, safe, tea and coffee, few magazines about Amsterdam and you even get a few British tv chanels The hotel is perfectly situated between the Central station and the Dam Square (about 5mins away either side) It is also within walking distance to most of the main museums. I dont have any negative things to say about the hotel - at least not from my experience - the breakfast is a little expensive at â‚¬15 but we didnt pay - you can always walk across the street to a few restaurants which offer full english breakfasts for â‚¬5 This is a great hotel and I would stay again if we go back to Amsterdam. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean and a good night sleep”
Reviews.Author: TheUsualSuspects
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my partner for one night to Amsterdam. The room is small but has got all the amenities you would expect from this kind of hotel. The bathroom gives not much privacy being a glass cube with just the middle part being screened out, which was ok for us but if you would share with a friend you are not to close with, it could be a problem. Also the lights in the bathroom are not ideal if you have to put make up on. That are our only negative points. The reception staff is really helpful and informative. The location is bang on in the city centre - just a stroll from the train station. We didn't try the breakfast, so we can't comment on this, but there are plenty of breakfast choices around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean”
Reviews.Author: sisphoenix76
Reviews.Content: Great spot to stay in, very centrally located, 5 min walk to train station. Great restaurants around the hotel, walking distance to Red light without being in the Red Light district. Rooms were quaint, and clean. Bathrooms have glass walls, but don't worry the glass is frosted where it matters. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LaHols
Reviews.Content: Excellent city centre location, close to train station, shops and attractions. Rooms were fantastic and staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ftoja
Reviews.Content: Good location, easy parking in front. Good value for money for single stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_KNA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect, it was close to everything with plenty of good coffee shops nearby, the Red Light District was only a 5 minute walk away, there's a mini one on the side of the hotel (3 windows) but no one was ever in them. There's many good restaurants around the area. Close to shopping, and the best part... only a 5 minute walk from Central Station. It was so good, we're going back in November and taking 8 friends with us. Bathroom probably not the best for shy people. The glass doesn't leave much to the imagination, but you'll get over it!

Reviews.Title: “A calm oasis in the middle of everything you'd want to see”
Reviews.Author: JacquelynMcCrary
Reviews.Content: We originally had booked a B&B nearby, but after visiting it in person, we decided to pay for just one night and cancel the other three. Then, we quickly tried to try to find someplace better. This hotel was just down the street and was very accomodating to us, especially because we booked it at the last minute. We had been traveling for two weeks and had two large bags with us. This hotel actually had an elevator, which saved my husband's back! Our room was located in the center of the hotel, so even though we were near the Red Light District, our room was quiet and our twinbeds pushed together were comfortable. However, there was no air conditioning, in spite of what the clerk at the front desk said we were paying for, and there was nowhere to put our clothes or our suitcases other than in the corner on the floor. The room was oddly shaped because it was in the center. The bathroom was a bit too small to navigate comfortably between the toilet and the sink and the hairdryer didn't work at all. I brought my own washcloths with distictive gold embroidery that had been recently purchased in Edinburgh. The hotel maids stole them from the room the first day we were there, which was disappointing. We bought the expensive breakfast in the coffee shop downstairs one morniing and it made us both sick. The creamer containers for the coffee in the lobby was partially solid, rather than fresh, so that may have made us sick, as well. The room was way too small. However, it was a last-minute decision, so I wasn't expecting much, and the staff at the front desk were very nice. I would be more demanding of a better room, such as the ones in the pictures, if I were to return.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Phils26
Reviews.Content: Reminds me of staying in a basic cruise ship room; very tiny, few amenities, but fabulous location and courteous staff. PROS: courteous reception desk staff, who even personally searched the housekeeping closets for shampoo that the housekeeping neglected to leave for me; quiet room on the back street (louder facing the main street); great shower; free wired internet in your room; location, location, location; 5 minute walk to the train station, which is a 15-20 minute train ride to the airport; 5 minute walk to the Red Light District, and to Dam Square (the central town square meeting area). CONS: they ran out of shampoo, so I had to buy my own; tiny room you can barely walk around in; 2 stackable, molded plastic chairs you might find at a Wal Mart, and no other sitting options; wireless internet costs extra; business center computer nonfunctional re internet access; a thick comforter enclosed by a fitted bed sheet is your only option, so it can get uncomfortably warm under the covers; expensive for what you get, because of the location...once you realize how easy it is to walk around the entire tourist area, you might consider a less expensive hotel in the other tourism areas of the city.

Reviews.Title: “In Amsterdam? Fab location...and clean!”
Reviews.Author: bob_brotchie
Reviews.Content: On approach to this hotel, which I had pre-booked online via Expedia (and enjoyed a discounted rate) I was a little concerned! It does tend to look like an Italian restaurant!! However, as soon as we entered, it became apparent this hotel has some class. The lobby was outstanding, a wonderful calm oasis, nice lighting and furnishings, tidy and spotlessly clean. The staff welcomed us but were 'functional' rather than outstanding. We were given a 5th floor room and keycards which are used to access the Hotel late at night, the lifts at all times and the room itself. Each time the cards are used the information is recorded. Security is important to the hotel and I was generally impressed. The 5th floor was a useful assignment as the noise of the passing traffic and trams can be quite annoying - though to be expected. The room was 'compact' but large enough for my friend and I to move around without colliding all the time. Room furnishings were modern and 'funky', the a/c didn't however appear to work and the windows had a very limited opening which, even so then of course increased the noise of traffic. This made the room somewhat stuffy even though the temperature outside ranged from 7-18 Degrees Celsius. The room had an unusual 'feature' in that the shower, sink and WC are all in an opaque glass 'box' in one corner! You do need to be comfortable with the lack of privacy when dressing/undressing, showering or using the loo!!! Overall the hotel is in a great location close to Central station , shopping , the canals and of course, the red light district...all walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Strange Rooms - but serves its purpose well”
Reviews.Author: juejosh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights 31st Aug & 1st Sept; We had booked via lastminute.com and paid Â£185 for the 2 nights room only (plus 10.30 euros city tax on departure). On booking the hotel, which stated rooms with bath or shower and twin or double bed, we emailed the hotel directly to request (a) a room with double bed and bath and also (b) an early check-in room, as our flights arrived in Amsterdam at approx 9.15am, so with luggage reclaim, train etc we anticipated arriving at the hotel at approx 11am. We received no reply from our requests so again emailed asking the same; we received a reply stating that we had booked a delux room - which do not have baths, and that as the hotel was full the night before they did not think we could have an early check-in room but would try to accomodate us if they could. The hotel is a short walk from the station (cost of train is 3.70 euros pp each way) and very easy to get to, even with pushing a wheelchair and carrying luggage. On arrival we did find that our room was not yet ready, but where offered to leave luggage there until we could get into our room. We had a wander around the nearby shopping area stopping for some early lunch before heading back, at about 2pm to be handed our room key straight away. The male receptionist was very helpful and friendly, offering us information on the city, however as it was our 5th visit to Amsterdam we had our schedule sorted out. He told us to just ask if we wanted/required anything. Our room (401) was on the 4th floor, and the first room next to the lift, and while the location was good, not only could we here the people in and out of the lift, plus the lift workings (working all night!). The room is a very strange configuration - as we opened the door we were greeted by a desk, with 2 transparrent plastic chairs; directly behind the desk was the bed, whch was 2 single beds - made as singles, not as a double as is usual on the continent - but together, with the end of the bed against the wall, with the tv mounted on the wall, just above the bed; that wall was carpeted, and whilst it looked strange and felt a very clostophobic area, it worked to give access to both sides of the bed. The bathroom, as previously mentioned is seperated from the main bedroom area by a glass door, with just a frosted panel in the middle and clear glass at top and bottom, the door opens either way and does not shut firm. In the bathroom, there is a toilet, glassed sink, and a shower with large rain shower power head, in a glass cubicle. There was also a hairdryer, the usual hotel type , attached to the wall. There are ammenities provided but these are only soap and body lotion (and shower cap) not any shower gel or shampoo, which would be more useful - especially as we did not bring any as we were travelling with hand luggage only, and expected it to be provided as we had read that toiletries were provided. There was a small wardrobe/storage area, however if you were spending more than 2 or 3 nights there the space would not be enough to unpack and store clothing. In the wardrobe area there was a free electronic safe, and in one of the drawers of the desk was a tray with tea/coffee cups and kettle. We did not have breakfast at the hotel so cannot comment - only to add should you wish, breakfast costs 15 euros per person. The hotel is in easy reach of most parts of the city, and with a tram stop outside the front door of the hotel, it is in a good location, just one word of warning though, just around the corner of the hotel are some 'windows' which are part of the Singel RLD area, and this continues to the rear of the hotel - wasnt a problem for us as we knew about it from previous visits, but just so you are aware should you be easily offended. All in all we enjoyed our stay, and after becoming accustomed to the set out of the room we were actually very comfortable. Especially on the second night, as we had asked for extra towels to help me in the shower, and they provided a shower seat plus the extra towels. There was room for my wheelchair in the room, but not around the room, and the hotel was accessable. Would stay again if the Inntel (which is accross the road) was fully booked or much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and a small but perfectly formed hotel room”
Reviews.Author: Amy001
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located in the centre of Amsterdam. We stayed in one of the renovated rooms which was very small but stylishly decorated. The shower was amazing - a rain fall shower. The room was very clean and cleaned daily. We did not include breakfast as part of our stay but there are plenty of cafes nearby that do breakfast and lunches. I thought this was an excellent hotel and would highly recommend it for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location - center of everything!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingOYEster
Reviews.Content: This was an adorable hotel. I was in Amsterdam solo - so my room was perfect for me, I am not sure how it would have been with another person - as it was small and the bathroom had no privacy. The staff were great at pointing me in the right direction and helping me arrange cars and tours. It would have been a perfect stay; however my last night was spent listening to a bachelor party (which isn't the hotel's fault) - but they couldn't seem to quiet the group down or remind them to go out and party as they are in Amsterdam. Geez! Overall, I loved the location as it was walking distance to everything..

Reviews.Title: “Ineffective room layout; friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ilard
Reviews.Content: Easy to reach from the Centraal train station. Staff were friendly and attentive. Room was small, but worse, very awkwardly shaped. I had a double room, but if I had been travelling with my girlfriend as well I think we would have struggled to move about itâ€™s trapezium shaped walls. For example, to get to the window you have to pass through a gap of about 25 cms â€“ and guess where they located the wall mounted LCD TV â€“ yes, right were the narrowest possible part of the access is. I lost count of the times I bashed by shoulder against the TV, but fortunately it did not break. The bathroom was a large glass cubicle which was only part-frosted. Even if you and your partner are not embarrassed about sitting on the toilet when in the same room, it still would not be especially pleasant to see, hear, and smell EVERYTHING. For such a central hotel, I thought outside noise was well softened. I liked the staff because they were polite, knowledgeable, and efficient. Recommended for short stays only else you may be driven mad by the room size, shape and layout.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem.”
Reviews.Author: AGvanderWesthuizen
Reviews.Content: I can highly recommend this hotel. Located in the heart of Amsterdam, close to everything. The staff is most helpful and very friendly. The room layouts are different but great fun and very user-friendly. Do go for breakfast. It is excellent!! Three star but five star service.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, bright, easily reachable from train station, cafes nearby - good for couples”
Reviews.Author: h3o
Reviews.Content: Before the Westcord we had stayed 2 nights in a town house (La Boheme, which was great for the typical Dutch experience of stairs of an old building near Leidseplein. This first hotel was cheaper and had breakfast included). However, not realising how small (well, walkable) Amsterdam is, I booked this place to be nearer the train station as we wanted to escape the crowds and visit some smaller towns in the North. I am glad we had the contrast of the 2 hotels. The Westcord lacked the character of the other place - you could have been anywhere once inside (but the lift was a bonus!!) The room was small, clean, with TV, power shower behind the frosted glass wall and had free toiletries. We overlooked the road with trams but there was no noise. 5-10 mins walk from the train station. (Allow more to look at things!!). We printed our own train tickets in advance - all very smooth. Breakfast was 14 EUR. We paid 99 EUR for the room (+tourist tax of about 5 EUR) and didn't have breakfast at the hotel (apart from an apple at reception!) - there are lots of options close by for half the cost. I'd definitely stay there again. Good room. Staff were professional and helpful and we were able to check in hours early - we thought we would just leave our bags but were lucky enough to get the room early. Free tea and coffee in the room was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Happyhols12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in August and it was great! The rooms were small but trendy-frosted glass wall to bathroom. It was a short walk to Dam Square, red light district, shopping centres etc. Didnt have breakfast as there was plenty of cafes nearby. All in all if your looking for a nice place to lay your head for a reasonable price you cant go wrong here!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: danceofjimbeam
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned after 5 nights at the Westcord city centre, and overall we were pleased with the hotel, and the location was amazing. The room wasn't large but the bed was very comfortable and there was free wired internet in the room, as well as a water kettle for coffee and tea. One thing that disappointed me was the tv, i like to hook our laptop up to the tv via hdmi and that wasn't possible with this set, it must've been super old. The movies they offered were all pretty old and they charged 12.50 euros per. Also i don't think our sheets got changed once the entire stay, although they did clean everything else pretty thoroughly. The staff were all extremely nice and helpful. The location is the real reason to stay at this hotel. You can walk to dam square in 2 minutes, same for central station. There are tons of coffeeshops nearby, and the red light district is a block away or so. It was hard to find good restaurants but the hotel gave us a coupon for tora dorado argentinian steakhouse and it was excellent, we ate there twice. All in all it was a great trip, thanks mainly to the excellent location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: LC888
Reviews.Content: I was a bit apprehensive about staying at this place as there was a review here stating the existence of bed bugs. However, I could not find any other hotel which is close to the city centre which have the option of accommodating three in a room. I traveled with my mother and my brother, all adults. The location is excellent. On our first evening, all the lifts were out of order, hence, we have to walk up the stairs to level 5! Perhaps not what one looks forward to at the end of the day! The bathroom is extremely small especially the space where the WC is located. If you are larger than UK size 10, I don't think you can fit in that gap. My mom was super paranoid about the frosted glass bathroom and claimed that she can see me clearly when i was naked! I didn't particularly want to see my mom naked, so, I didn't pry to verify her claim. It is a bit awkward especially since you can hear everything; not so pleasant when one is doing the second business in the loo if you know what I mean. All in all, I would recommend this hotel purely for its location but it's rather expensive for what it is. The hotel should really renovate the corridor walls as they are old and some render/wall paper had fallen/torn off and it really smell musty along the corridors.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect...”
Reviews.Author: MajusC00L
Reviews.Content: And I mean it. Ideally located as you'll read in most of all other advices, friendly and very professional employees, secured luggage room to get the most of your last day in Amsterdam, ..., I never tried another hotel in Amsterdam but I'm quite sure this one sets the standard quite high among the three stars? There are two little things that really bugged me though. When I booked the room I booked for one double bed in the room and certainly not two single beds. When we got in the room, we were quite impress by the nice modern and optimal decorations and furnitures and It looked like we got what we wanted but we soon found out that the double bed was more a pair of single beds and each one had its own set of sheets wich cause something I really hate when I expect a good night with my partner, a phisical and uncomfortable frontier gab between the beds. A real bummer to me and I still hated it two days later. So Westcord, real double beds please! The other annoying thing is that the wall isolating the toilets/shower room from the bedroom is made of... glass ! there is only a white translucent sticker covering the window from knee height to shoulder height for a make-believe privacy. If, like me, you do not enjoy being smelt, heard or seen while you do your daily thing, this is quite an issue as well. My partner and I had to ask the other one to leave for a few minutes for more privacy. Hence, Westcord is almost perfect, but really? Not perfect. ;-) I thought the price was okay (double occ @ 130â‚¬ /day/without breakfast) considering the last minute booking from my part and the season (mid July)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MrPlums
Reviews.Content: i've been going to Amsterdam at least once a year for the last 5 years and have found that any hotel which costs less than 100Euro per night is appalling and I'm not even that picky!. The Westcord was a great hotel and fantastic value for money. I stayed in a twin room on the third floor for 80Euro per night (split with my friend worked out at 40 per night each). The room was small but clean. It was modern with a flat screen television. The bathroom and shower were attractive, spacious and immaculately clean. I stayed in the Hilton in Amsterdam last year and the Westcord was virtually as good. The location is superb- 2 minutes walk from Dam Square. It also has free Wifi- better than most 5 star hotels The only drawbacks were- 1. The Wifi in my room wasn't very good strength. 2.My pillow was uncomfortable (though I didn't complain). I will be staying in this hotel from now on every time I visit Amsterdam. If you're looking for a base to explore Amsterdam this is a perfect choice..

Reviews.Title: “Superb value for money”
Reviews.Author: WitNit
Reviews.Content: I spent a night on business and thought this place much better at the price than other hotels in Amsterdam. It's within very easy walking distance from Centraal Station as well as to tourist attractions and shopping. The room, whilst compact, was spotless and with a nice view into town. The staff is friendly and helpful, the breakfast bar very useful and, to top it all, they have possibly the cheapest shuttle service to the airport in all of Amsterdam (â‚¬9 p.p.). I would certainly stay there again - but probably not if I travelled with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and value for money - See through Bathrooms brill!”
Reviews.Author: Legspin
Reviews.Content: We arrived early morning before check in time and the staff where very helpful allowing us to leave our baggage in the luggage room so we could make the most of the day. Our room was very clean, with modern decoration. The see through bathroom was not a problem at all and added to the character. The rooms were air conditioned which was brilliant because it was very hot. We asked for and got quiet rooms on the 5th floor so we did not hear any noise from outside. The hotel is a few hundred meters from Central Station and we walked their in less than 10 minutes. We did not eat in th hotel but there are many bars and restaurants in the area. Brilliant hotel, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: gould321
Reviews.Content: Me and my FiancÃ© stayed here for one night in June. Having been Amsterdam a few times before and knowing the area I'd say this hotel is placed in the best part for everything! Just outside is the the trams to everywhere and anywhere. You can nearly see the train station to your left and dam square to your right! The hotel lobby and reception are really nice and modernly classy. Our room (411) was spotless and felt massive compared to the"normal" sized rooms in Amsterdam hotels. Hotel provides tickets for every attraction in Amsterdam with cheaper rates for some attractions too. Breakfasts are an extra 15 euros per person. I thought this was pretty expensive so decided to go the shop next door that has great fresh fruit outside, but one drink of orange and some grapes came to 10 euros so i now wish i would have just gone with the hotels breakfasts. The satalite tv is quite good. internet also. The only slight problem i would say that was wrong with the hotel is that the old windows let a lot of noise in from the tram stops outside the hotel. Our timing was pretty bad as they were half way thru construction of the tram lines so outside the hotel was kind of a building site. Not the hotels fault but the noise from the trams was very noticeable all night. All in all i loved my stay at the westcord and having been in other hotels in Amsterdam i think next time i return it will be to westcord from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: IzzyOxfordshire
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room, friendly welcome and within walking distance of the Central railway station. The tram stops just outside the hotel so the location is brilliant. Many restaurants,cafes and shops on the doorstep. Not the cheapest hotel, and breakfast was offered at 15 euros/person, a little expensive in my opinion. We headed out into the city and had breakfast in a different cafe/restaurant every day. I highly recommend the Dutch pancakes! The room was clean, the bed comfortable, the bathroom spotless. My husband was delighted to have free wifi access. However, I would not recommend this hotel if you are going to share the room with a friend. The bathroom is basically a corner of the room partitioned off by glass (frosted to half way up) and therefore neither private or sound-proof! Not a problem if you're sharing with your partner of 25 years, but probably not so suitable for friends (even good ones!).

Reviews.Title: “Great location & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: derwent10
Reviews.Content: Although a little expensive for the size of the room the location and staff made up for this. We arrived early expecting to leave our luggage however we were able to check into our room early and even given a choice depending on how quiet we wanted it to be. Its a good job i stayed with my husband as i'm not sure the glass door on the bathroom would suit those who don't now each other too well or are a little conservative! Wev didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, at 15 euros each we felt it was too expensive however you are within easy walking distance to plenty of other options. Having a kettle in the room was great although it is kept in a drawer with no label on it so its not that easy to find. The shower could have done with a non slip mat however that is the only fault we could find. The staff on the desk couldn't be faulted, they were very attentive without being intrusive they also have local knowledge invaluable for local transport saving us over 80 euros.

Reviews.Title: “You better book this one quick !”
Reviews.Author: Rollerball999
