Reviews.Content: This is an awesome hotel in a great location in Amsterdam. Location - GREAT (3 mins walk from Central Station, 5 mins walk to Dam Square, 5 mins walk to Red Light District). The tram stops at the hotel door. There are loads of bars and restaurants nearby the hotel so you dont have to worry about food at all. Room - Super clean and cozy room with a modern setting and very clean and good size washroom. The room size is small but that is expected at any hotel in Europe. However, they made the best use of space and had great decor. Service - Great. My laptop could not connect with their wired ethernet port in the room so they provided me with a Wireless pass to connect to the internet free of charge. They will do most of the tour bookings for you at the hotel itself. I would definitely stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: chilepepperlover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last month for 3 nights. Very close to the train station, great location. But unfortunately, I can't recommend staying here as my husband and I were feasted upon by bedbugs. We ended up covered with bites. An unfortunate ending to our otherwise great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms not to all tastes, Overall Good though.”
Reviews.Author: goodgrr
Reviews.Content: To summarise and concur some of the earlier comments; Great location, tram stop (with lots of routes) outside the hotel; Rooms small but normal for many European hotels; "interesting" room layout and glass bathroom; No bar (but plenty within short walks); Expensive breakfast and many alternative and cheaper locations very close. Overall a good choice for a few days in Amsterdam. Would strongly recommend the Humphrey's restaurant in the Alley across the road. It's a chain but offer an excellant value three course menu. Well presented and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun at the stylish Hotel WestCord”
Reviews.Author: philevil82
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights last week with my boyfriend and four other friends and we had a fab time! The hotel is in an excellent location, you can walk to all the main sites, and there's a tram stop right outside. Slightly dodgy alleys here and there, it's quite close to the red light district, but the hotel is very safety concious, you swipe to get into the hotel and to use the lift after 10.30. Only 5mins from train station, and 10mins walk from jordaan with some gorgeous eateries and great pubs, bars and cafes close by. The rooms are pretty small, with the bed right in the middle facing a flat screen tv on the wall, and the glass bathroom is an aquired taste, but the bed was very cosy indeed, and the shower really powerful! The glass sinks are pretty cool too! My only complaint was the heat in the room, the window backed onto an internal courtyard, so no breeze, and the air-con wasn't really doing the business, so we were far too warm, but then the waether was unseasonably sunny, so I don't think that was the norm. Don't bother with breakfast, 15E is very steep and right opposite the hotel is Coffee Connection, a lovely little coffee place that makes legendary paninis and bagels! Nyom. So, great location, very reasonable price, cosy rooms and a great base to see the city, it's a 4.5/5 really, just the hot rooms that let it down from a 5!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely NO complaints!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelFanCork
Reviews.Content: Thrilled with this hotel!! Its location is utterly fabulous! The hotel is within walking distance of Central Station, Dam Square, Red Light District, Anne Frank House etc. The hotel itself is very security conscious with a requirement to use your room key for the front door after a certain hour. The room is cosy and for some the glass bathroom may be off putting but....if it's a sightseeing break you are going for make this hotel your base!!! No bar though (only gripe)!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but room is too small...”
Reviews.Author: davidcml
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights while taking some time off between business trips from Europe and back to Asia, and didn't want to spend on too on the luxury hotel. The location of the hotel is great, right in the city centre (new side) and a short walk away from the major points such as central station, canals boat pier, Damrak, Dam square etc. And the best part is, unlike the streets of Damrak, Martelaarsgracht or central station areas, Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal; the street where the hotel is located is actually fairly quiet, so, no unwanted buzz from the street or nearby parties at night to distract you from your sleep. Service level is fine but comfort wise, I found even the deluxe room is too small for the price I paid. Nevertheless the room was fairly well appointed (with good quality matress for a sound sleep), the housekeeping was diligent, and the wired boardband is at top speed when ever I used it... and it is free :) Would recommend this hotel if just just for a couple of night and if you put central location over other factors. Else, I think you can get a better room for the same price just few KM away, like around the Museum Quarters, Amstel and Vondelpark areas, which are also equally good locations for different kinds of considerations.

Reviews.Title: “Best 3 star hotel I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: yosh7795
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on one of the main streets in Amsterdam. We drove here and this hotel has no parking so instead they have a service where a company picks up your car and stores it at their lot. This service cost 30 euro for the first day and 20 euro for the second. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and even set up tours for us to the Keukenhof Tulip park. We had a deluxe room and it was very nice and clean, a little on the small side if you care about space (I really don't). The room had free wired internet (need to pay for wireless) and a cool glass theme in the bathroom/shower. The most important feature for me in any room is the bed and this one did not disappoint. It was firm and very comfortable, especially after a full day/night of walking around. Most of the TV channels are english spoken as well as most of the people in Amsterdam. You cannot beat the location of this hotel, about a 5-10 min walk to anything i.e. Anne Frank house, red light district, central train station etc. I was surprised to see this hotel was a 3 star, to me it should be a 4 or 5. I really loved Amsterdam; everyone's a tourist there. I will come back again and when I do, this hotel is the only choice for me.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, would recommend it”
Reviews.Author: LKCW
Reviews.Content: The WestCord City Centre Hotel Amsterdam is in a great location, only a short walk from the central train station. The staff are very friendly. Security is good as key cards are required for entering the building at night. The room is very modern and the decor is lovely. It was clean, quiet and comfortable. I would recommend not booking breakfast as it is an extra â‚¬15 and there are plenty of nice places nearby to have breakfast at a more reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location - good price - not for the fussy.”
Reviews.Author: Gloabtrodder
Reviews.Content: My first impression, walking in to the lobby, was better than expected. The area was quite spacious and welcoming. The clerk at the front desk found my reservation rather quickly (I had only booked online about 18 hours prior) and the whole check-in process was very smooth. The lady confirmed that I was the only person in the room, gave me my key card then sent me on my way. Not everyone would like my room. No one I know would like the carpets (which featured that "not steam-cleaned since before the war look") but the size was more than adequate for Europe and I noted by looking at the floor plan on the back of the door that I had the largest room on the floor. The main drawback was that the room overlooked the main street so that came with noise. The streets were wet with recent rain so that amplified the noise of the buzzing cars, buses and tramways. The floor to ceiling windows let in plenty of light, most of it electric, but I am an easy sleeper so I didn't mind. The lighting inside the room is not very practical. The television was of good quality and the bathroom was small and basic. It was not a room one would enjoy hanging out it but for what I paid (90 or 95 Euro), I can't complain. The location is awesome - a quick walk from Centraal station and to anywhere in the city centre. The price (for Europe) was acceptable and considering it was just for a night, it was more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN HOTEL IN EXCELLENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Stacey1982
Reviews.Content: We got to Central Station and headed to the right in order to get to the hotel. I would say it is a 5-10min walk. We got to the hotel about 10.30am and went to reception to ask if we could leave our bags there. The receptionist advised that our room was ready so we were able to check in which we were happy with. The receptionist took my credit card details and gave us the room key along with a map. We were in room 503 which was a deluxe room. The room is nicely decorated but is very small however it isnt much of a problem as we were not there to stay in the room all day. As you walk into the room, the bathroom is to the left which is sectioned off by frosted glass which does not offer much privacy however if you are sharing with a partner it shouldnt matter too much. The bathroom was very clean and the shower was nice and hot. The foot of the bed was against the wall with the head of the bed having a table and 2 chairs against it. The broadband is free in the duluxe room however I did not use this. There was a flat screen TV on the wall which had a few English speaking channels on there such as BBC 1 and 2 along with CNN. The bed was comfortable with lovely pillows. The room took a while to warm up however it was very cold outside as it was snowing. The only real negative thing I can say about the room was that there was a musty smell in there which then got into your clothes. and the cleaners start very early and you can hear them knocking around. If you leave the DO NOT DISTURB sign up, they will not knock on your door however you can hear them knocking on other peoples doors! Also, it does state that of you do not take the sign down by 12.30pm, your room will not be cleaned. We took ours down after this time and came back to a clean room which was a bonus. We did not pay for the breakfast as I think 15 Euros per person is a bit much. Dam Square was straight across the road through some walkways - only about a 5 - 10 minute walk. We caught the number 16 tram to heineken museum which was about a 10 minute ride and the cost to get in was 15 Euros and I would recommend going there as we spent a good few hours in there. All in all had a good two nights at the hotel and would recommend as it is good value for money and it centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a makeover”
Reviews.Author: overthepondhoppers
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after looking through reviews on this website. Most of the reviews were good, especially about the great location. However, the bad ones were about the rooms that had not been renovated. Well, I must have had one of those rooms and believe me, I'm not a hotel snob. I've even stayed at Bob's Hostel in Amsterdam. The lobby was okay...the elevator was a little smelly but okay...step out of the elevator into the hallway and it smelled. The configuration of the room was strange. The toilet and shower were in a small space behind a door but the sink was in the room with a partition between it and the bed. Speaking of the bed. It was just twins pushed together, still with their individual bedding. The mattress was so hard I had difficulty sleeping. The double windows that opened to the street were nice but the street was noisy. If you stay here I would make sure you got a renovated room. Like I said before...great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SadKate
Reviews.Content: Less than five minutes walk from Dam Square so the location is great. The price was fine (best price found on their own website) and the room was stylish, modern and well maintained. There is parking right across the road (an NCP style long underground long stay) but it was pretty expensive. Only stayed one night and didn't eat so not much more to say but it was clean, stylish, well-located and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Good location at a good price.”
Reviews.Author: ajgone Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel. Double bed with satellite TV. Small bathroom but had great power shower. Free in room safe. Hotel was in a great location for exploring Amsterdam. Â£75 for one nights stay including breakfast no other charges. Would certainly recommend hotel to anyone wanting to explore Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel 5mins away from Dams Square”
Reviews.Author: InspirationLondon
Reviews.Content: Stylish hotel just a few minutes away from Amsterdam attractions. The staff is very polite and helpful and the atmosphere is relaxed. It was a shame breakfast was not included in the room rate (it would save you a good walk to coffee places/patisseries which are not close by), so if you can try to get it included because if you want to have breakfast it will cost you aroun â‚¬ 15 per person per day!! Other than that I'd recommend this hotel: good value for money, clean and great location!

Reviews.Title: “very nice and great location!”
Reviews.Author: scrumpyscrumps
Reviews.Content: this hotel was very comfortable and not far from everything you would want to see in amsterdam! my friend and i felt very safe, the staff was friendly, and the hotel made touring the city easy! i would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I'd definitely stay there again...”
Reviews.Author: Deenie76
Reviews.Content: I chose to spend a couple of nights at this hotel due to reviews here on Tripadvisor and due to my Dutch friend confirming the location was central. and I wasn't at all disappointed! I arrived at Central Station on the 15 minute train from Schiphol airport and walked to the hotel with no problem (approx 10 mins). I stayed in room 603 on the top floor, unfortunately I didn't have the amazing views I thought I would get being on the top floor, but I didn't mind at all. 603 is a 'deluxe single room' but please don't have any visions of grandeur... whilst the room is gorgeously clean modern and clean, it is absolutely TINY! However, as a solo traveller, it doesn't need to be huge anyway. The shower room is lovely, the shower itself is AMAZING (didnt want to get out) and the bed was extremely comfortable. The location of the hotel was great. Just walk across the road to go in the direction of a Fitness First gym, numerous 'coffee shops' (regular and not-so-regular!), and shops of every single kind. H&M, Footlocker, Bershka etc - its a shoppers haven. Also within walking distance is Dam Square where they have a nice little coffee shop called 'Coffee Company' and lots of beautiful historical buildings. Also worth checking out in the area is Magna Plaza Shopping Centre, what a lovely building! The only complaint I had about this hotel is that both mornings, I was woken up early by the VERY loud cleaner cleaning the room next door. Vacuuming, moving things around, dropping things, opening and closing (slamming) doors etc. Being woken up early when you're away on a break and staying awake late really ISN'T what you want! That issue aside, I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the box”
Reviews.Author: impavidus
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't be better. I had a double room and this was slightly on the small side, fine for a one night, but would have been difficult for people on a longer stay and with more luggage. Having said so the room was very clean and functional. I didn't have breakfast so I can't comment, but I had one of the best cappuccinos I have ever had in the small cafe just over the road.

Reviews.Title: “great location, deluxe rooms lovely, will stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: Juliefarg
Reviews.Content: Could'nt ask for a better location, staff very friendly and rooms were very clean and modern. Would,nt stay anywhere else in the Dam now we've stayed here. Hope to visit again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location of the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Boia
Reviews.Content: Me and my partnet travelled to Amsterdam for just an overnight stay, flew out early and then came back on an evening flight the next day so, was looking for a hotel near the station and also near all the action that Amsterdam has to offer. The hotel was easy to find, we didn't take a map with us, just followed the tram line and it was literaly 5 mins walk. We arrived at the hotel at around 10:30 a.m., we were just going to leave our 2 bags there and the receptionist told us that the room was ready and that she could check us in. What a great start! On check-in she also gave us a map which was a nice touch. The room was perfectly designed, ok...it's a bit of the small side, but who cares when you are just there to sleep? Loved everything about the room, the rain shower, the fact that there's a free safe, and the glass sink! We booked a deluxe room so not sure what the normal rooms are like, saying that the deluxe room only cost us an extra Â£5 when we booked through booking.com, so might be worth paying the little extra to get a nicer room. We were expecting noise as it being so central, but we didn't hear anything and had a great night sleep. Saying that we were allocated a room on the back street, not sure what would it be like facing the main road where the trams runs past. The hotel also has a luggage room to leave your bags (free of charge) after check-out if you have a late flight. All the staffs that we encountered during our one night stay seemed nice. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will definately book here again next time we are in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Last leg of our European Odyssey”
Reviews.Author: JanV
Reviews.Content: The Tulip Inn easily won the prize for being the worst hotel of the six hotels we stayed at in Europe. Value for money was dreadful. The hotel staff were rude, abrubt, uncaring and deceitful. Our room was outrageously priced, dirty, not air conditioned with virtually no ability to cool the room using the window. The room was not clean, but offered long, cold showers. Yes, cold showers as the boiler broke down on the first day and was not large enough to meet the needs of guests on the second day. Hotel staff offered a shrug when we complained. I hate this hotel and have/will make every effort to tell anyone who will listen that the Tulip Inn is a lousy place to stay. I could go on.............

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nicely Furnished but Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: PBWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our Amsterdam leg of our Europe trip. The location was excellent! It was 5 minute walk from the Central Station trainstop and within walking distance to a majority of the tourist sites. We only took the tram once to go to the Van Gogh museum since it was raining and that would have taken maybe 20-25 to walk. The rooms are on the small size but this is normal by European standards. We got the deluxe room which has free internet and A/C though we could not get the internet to work. The deluxe room had gone thru renovations so this seemed to be newer than the non deluxe. This was partly due to the laptop we had was borrowed from somone locally and was in German so we had a difficult time translating things. Beware that the bathroom offers little privacy as the walls are partly glass and frosted in the middle sections so that someone laying in bed can see the other person using the toilet. Toilet is also in a very narrow space between the wall and side of the glass shower. So if you are not a slim person, you will have a tight squeeze to sit down. The shower was nice size and had very hot water that almost can be scalding. Interesting clear glass sink and table top. Down side is there was no storage space to spread out your toiletries. The bed appeared to be queen size but like many European beds, there are 2 mattresses so there is a gap running between the 2. The room has a wall safe but no minibar. The A/C worked very well and unlike the hotels in Germany which seemed to run warm. The weather was not hot but having the A/C run helped to remove stale air and any humidity in the room. One thing I did not notice until the end of our trip was that out the back entrance of the hotel, there were 2 red light booths next to the hotel in addition to a gay video store. So if you have any kids, suggest you steer them away from the back entrance. But then again this is Amsterdam so they will eventually see this anyway should you go anywehere near the red light district!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: CatkinsCornwall
Reviews.Content: Location of hotel is very convenient for trams, canal bus and central station with many bars and restaurants close by. The hotel rooms are very modern and clean but extremely small and its absolutely true about the lack of privacy in the bathroom. The bathroom is enclosed by frosted glass except for where the toilet is and the door has no lock either. We also had trouble with our safe. It did not work and the staff were off hand and disinterested in getting it mended or even apologising to us seemed to be not in their job desciption. We had a good time in amsterdam I would stay in the area again but look for a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “A real good hotel and a brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: ArbitRabbit
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Tulip Inn for 4 nights with my partner and must say I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Location: The hotel is in an excellent location, about 500m from the central train station. It is also well serviced by trams 1,2,5,13 and 17, and Dam square is a short walk away. Rooms: I booked a standard room but was offered a Deluxe room instead when I got to the hotel. The Deluxe rooms are bigger and you get free internet access and you don't have to pay for the room safe as with the standard room. Cleaniness: In general, rooms are very clean and the room service is efficient. Don't forget to hang the do not disturb signn outside your room if you had a late night, else the room service starts knocking on your door from about 9 AM onwards. A minor incident, which in no way should influence your decision about this hotel, was that I discovered a small spider on the room curtain. But other than that, no problems whatsoever. Other than that, the staff are friendly and helpful. You can book a lot of activities from within the hotel and the hotel also provides you guides etc. on Amsterdam free of charge. Overall, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY WOULD GO BACK TOMORROW”
Reviews.Author: Naboo
Reviews.Content: My friend and myself stayed at the Tulip Inn centre for two nights on 24th August, and loved it. Staff were extremely helpful and provided us with maps and information on Amsterdam. The hotel was in an excellent location 10 min walk from Centraal station. Hotel was very clean , rooms were modern and comfy, loved the pillows very good nights sleep on those. There are tram stops directly outside the hotel with direct lines to major attractions such as Bloemenmarkt , Van Gogh Musuem and the Rijks. They do serve breakfast but it is 15 euros per person so we opted to eat breakfast in a bar opposite a full english for 6.50 euro tasty and set us up for a busy day touring Amsterdam. Tulip Inn was a great little hotel we loved it and will be back. one tip, ask at reception to buy a 24hour tram pass you can travel as many times on the tram system within 24 hours, you must touch in and out though or your card will be blocked, but worth the money. It costs 7 euros for the day. A single ticket on a tram will cost you 2.60 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Very Hip and Central Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: carrie1988
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tulip Inn for 3 nights and what an experience the rooms were absolutely amazing, the staff very helpful and the restaurant was great!

Reviews.Title: “Modern 3* in central location”
Reviews.Author: NFGS
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Tulip Inn Amsterdam Centre and were really impressed with the hotel. Most 3* in the City are dated and similar price and this hotel offered a good location with modern rooms and great showers. The hotel is a 5-10min walk from the station. My tip...when you leave the station exit towards the right, go left and you get lost! Check in was simple and there are lifts to all floors. The rooms are not massive but perfectly fine for 2 nights. The bathroom (like other reviews) is rather 'public' with not all the glass walls 100% frosted. If I was on the bed watching TV I could see my partner on the toilet! Dam Square is a 5min walk down one road, there is a tram stop opposite, bars nearby & supermarkets / souvenir shops more or less next door. Juicy aoples and fresh coffee in the mornings are a welcome treat too. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very economical, great location”
Reviews.Author: Grams98
Reviews.Content: nice room, small but to be expected; no disappointments at all, comfy beds, nice shower, convenient luggage storage after checkout. highly recommend for an economical stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: TheYarralls
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, room was wonderfully quiet, small but fine for a weekend stay. Staff were helpful and friendly. Helped make our trip great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Stringbean57
Reviews.Content: Great location. Easy walking to major attractions. Nice staff. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Ironing room?!?”
Reviews.Author: englander909
Reviews.Content: I have been to Amsterdam many times before so knew beforehand that this was a decent location and at Â£200 pounds for two nights pretty good value. Check in was functional and efficient if a bit cold, but going up to the room is was impressed with the lobby and general feel of the ground floor. The room was small but no smaller than you would expect for a room in any European city. I was impressed with the dÃ©cor and the furniture and appreciated the good use of what limited space there was. The bathroom was again well designed all in all a very modern and well thought-out room. My room and the hotel in general was very clean and tidy and housekeeping did a good job. Despite having a room that faced onto the road outside I didnâ€™t notice any excessive noise and the view of the rooftops much better than a car park or a set of rubbish bins. I did encounter what to me was a major inconvenience. Whenever I travel I prefer to iron my clothes (the smart ones at least) in my hotel room as I donâ€™t really see the point of ironing clothes just to fold them up into a cramped suitcase. This sometime means I have to persevere with rubbish hotel irons or having to wait an age for housekeeping to bring said iron. This hotel has a system I have not come across before: The hotel has an Ironing room on the 1st floor, no iron in the room and they will not deliver one to you. I found this to be a major pain as the ironing room was in the same room as the ice maker and wasnâ€™t really private. I canâ€™t imagine anyone wishing to stand in a public room and iron all their belongings, it felt weird and I personally felt uncomfortable. I might being a bit melodramatic but all the good work in terms of decoration cleanliness, value and general feel of the hotel was undermined by this. All in all stay in this hotel, it's great, as long as you donâ€™t want to iron anything!!

Reviews.Title: “Bargain trip to Aamsterdam possible”
Reviews.Author: Hot-Tati
Reviews.Content: We arrived by train late at night and walked to our hotel. Aabout 5 minute walk over a bridge and a quick jaunt throuugh busy street. EASY TO FIND WITH ITS RED AWNINGS.Near several places to eat and shop. Upon arrival we were promptly greeted by a man with multiplle language skills. We got a pretty good deal on the room. Published rack rates in the room are are in excess of $200.00 euro. We paid about 99.00 euro per niight. he even gave us a deal on the room for one mmore night. We were given two quick keys for the room, and took an elevator to the first floor. room 102. we walkked iin it iis smaller then a US hotel, but nicely done. The two beds were comfy and our wiindow faced several of the windows the girls work out of. so if you are looking for a an erotic veiw these are the rooms. 102, 103, and 104. We have a small table with chair, a vanity, closet with safe, and a bathroom. the bathroom is small, youu cansit on the toilet and touch the shower, counter and door, all at once. If youu are overweight the shower may be a bit of a problem, pregnant women beware.not much room to turn around. Very clean and well stocked with tea, coffee, and water cooker, sugar etc. If you brinng oackets of oatmeal, you van have a nice breakfast iin the room. ''the breakfast here iis $15.oo euro pper person. Nice atmosphere, but out of my comfort zone for breakfast fees. They offer a keyboard iin room for 7.50 euro per day. I amm usin giit now to write tihs. The walls re a bit thinn nd it is poossible to hear your nneighbors, and street noise, but overall iits very good. LOCATION AND SERVICE. Ddownside, the ice machinne did nnot work for the enntire tiimme, and I NEED to have my Ice. Front desk was always very helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel rooms for couples who want to sleep well and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Heta77
Reviews.Content: Even the all hotel rooms in old amsterdam town are small, this hotel offers cosy rooms with toilet/shower. There is everything in clean and small paggage. Breakfast was 15e, but we didn't event think about that becouse there was closed by minimarkets with fresh fruits, croisants, yoghurts, pizzas exc. There was online less than 5 min walk to centralstation, were all trams left and waterboats. And only 5 min walk to happening area DAM Square and onlin 1min walk to shopping street. That was 3star hotel with worth of all three stars. But if You would be fat, there will be problems of going to toilet seat, becouse that area is so narrou. If You are not museum person, this is even good location for everything. 24h or 3day tram/bus card is recormended if want to see a lot of in a small time. Kaukenhoff we missed because rain, unfortunately, but flower markets are recormended if you like flowers. In almous all hotels there is in the lobby those small card with what you will get discoutns, so watch those before going anywhere. And for ice, ask a cup from desk, and you can enjoy with your morning fruits with cold sparkling wine bought from winestore.

Reviews.Title: “I Made a Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: rayarpt
Reviews.Content: Using Tripadvisor, I decided to book 7 nights at the Tulip Inn. Great choice. Friendly helpful staff at all times allowed an early check in. Room was perfect, a little small (it is Europe), but very comfortable. I thought the breakfast buffet a bit pricey, but after checking around it was a fine value with excellent selections and ended up having 5 breakfasts there. Close to Central Station, The Dam, and 2 blocks from the major steet (Damask). Made it easy to walk to Lindbergh Tours for our 4 bus tours (Fantastic tour group). Around 20 restaurants a walk from the Tulip Inn and always felt safe walking around the area. I will definitely book them again without looking arounjd.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: morsky
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay in this hotel. It is well located in the central area, modern and functional, pleasantly accommodating with courteous staff, and not to mention itâ€™s very clean and well kept. I stayed in Tulip Inn in early March 2009 for four days. My room was a bit small for my taste (I live in the States), but I traveled alone and was very comfortable. The hotelâ€™s complimentary breakfast was very good and there are many good restaurants, bars and shops just a short walk away. I highly recommend this hotel to travelers especially singles and couples who wish to stay near the heart of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: SuziQ1349
Reviews.Content: Read all the reviews before i went and was worrying a bit about the glass toilet windows in the room as i was going with my mum!! But i think we got put into an older room so thankfully no glass doors!! The rooms were a bit small but didn't really matter as there was enough room for us both. Only bad thing was that we booked a twin room and ended up in a double for the first night then we got to move into a twin the next day, very annoying!! Also enjoyed being able to watch bbc1 and 2 when it was too wet to go out!! There is a lovely chinese on the hotels side towards the station, well worth the visit, especially the oysters, one word, huge!!! Overall a good hotel, and very good location. But both women on the front desk were not very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Morganz
Reviews.Content: This modern (retro decor) hotel is in a good location (not in a noisy area) near to central station (for ease of getting to/from the airport) and we were ably to easily walk to all the main tourist spots . We were also in easy reach of the canal bus ( it stops outside central station) which takes you to all the city sights. Our hotel room was clean and very presentable although small, but good enough for a weekend trip. Yes the bathroom was small but sufficient with frosted glass walls and door! I quite liked this quirky feature as the frosted glass didn't bother us as we are a couple. The breakfast was very good, slightly more than a continental breakfast, a good selection and fresh hot rolls.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: macd28
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very clean. Air conditioning didnt work and room got very hot at times. Staff were very nice and helpful. Excellent location,close to dam square and shopping. Breakfast buffet was excellent, something for everyone.would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: europaholic
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel in the city centre, clean, modern, comfortable and relaxing this is the one. It was good value for money and was very near all attractions. My wife found its location excellent as she could visit the room during our day walks in order to leave her shopping bags without that being a long distance journey! The bed was comfortable this helped us a lot after the long walks we had in Amsterdam...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near the Central Station and Dam square”
Reviews.Author: Marcia59
Reviews.Content: Before I went for a meeting in the Hague, from February 9 to 12, me and my sister decided to stop for 1 night in Amsterdam. For a short stay we needed a twin room close to the Central Station, Dam Square and museums. After exhausting web search of Amsterdam's hotels, I chose the Tulip Inn. We were pleasantly surprised. The hotel was exactly what we were looking for. The location is excellent, about 500 metres of the station, at easy walking distance of the city attractions, shops (Kalvermarkt street is just a step away), restaurants. Though in the very centre the neighbourhood is quite and we slept perfectly . The room was not big but not as small as described in some reviews. In the centre of Amsterdam I think that one couldn't expect much more for this price. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was kind and professional. We didn't have breakfast, but there were many facilities nearby. I'd recommend the hotel to anyone expecting to be centrally located in a comfortable room with reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel Chic Rooms and Great service”
Reviews.Author: KelvinYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Really great hotel especially for the price, early check in was no problem, the front desk staff very helpful and the rooms are very chic with good decor and plasma TV plus the bathroom is cool. Our room was at the rear and very quiet. Breakfast has everything and we could leave our bags during the day before and evening flight. Dam sq short walk and main station only 5 mins away. No hesitation in going back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: mrsmo81
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 12.02.09 to 15.02.09. Nice hotel with an excellent location. Located in the heart of amsterdam just a short walk from Dam Square and the Damrak. We chose a deluxe room and paid for this through ebookers. Due to booking a deluxe room on this website we had to pay a non refundable price for the hotel but this suited us fine. Upon arrival we were offered a deluxe room to the front or the back of the hotel. The front looks onto the main street with trams and restuarants etc and to the back a quieter street but quite dark almost so we chose the front and we were not disappointed. I found Amsterdam relatively quiet and we were told this was much to do with the recession. There was barely a person on the street at the front of the hotel after midnight and the trams were not noisey and could not be heard through the windows. We were room 214 (2nd floor). Yes the rooms are compact but if you are only here for 3 nights like we were this was not an issue. They were clean, modern, comfortable and trendy with a nice plasma screen. Not a huge amount of wardrobe space. The bathrooms are glass boxed cubes and yes, if you were here with someone you had only just started dating or with a work colleague this would be a definite no no. Although frosted in parts, the door is glass, the walls are glass and the door has an inch gap the whole way round so you can literally see and hear everything. This was no problem for my fiance and i however. Shower is excellent - big, powerful and very roomy! We got maid service every day. We chose not to take the hotel breakfast as at 15 euros a pop we felt it expensive. Amsterdam itself is very pricey!!! We now realise that this is not because everything is over priced in amsterdam but just due to the pound being soooo bad. Our money just flew away!! Seriously. Went there for 4 days and spent Â£500!! Drinks are thorugh the roof with 2 pints of beer/lager being 10 euros (which is more like Â£10 nowadays). Outrageous! Food was expensive also with a main course in a simple restaurant, nothing fancy at all, being 15-17 euros. We were even charged 7 euros for a coca cola in one mediocre restaurant. However, all that aside, i have to say i had the best 4 days and i wouldnt change a thing from the hotel, location, people, bars etc. I am just sad to be home! Feel free to ask me any more questions

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom design to small for the bigger boy”
Reviews.Author: Montydog
Reviews.Content: Lots of good things said by others on here abut this and the other Tulip inns in Amsterdam but one critisism I would have of the two central ones I have stayed in is that the bathroom design does not provide much privacy for you when you are using the toliet from your room partner. Also the width of the toilet cubicle between the wall and a glass screen is minute. I am 98 kilos/16 stone so large but far from enormous - my shoulders hardly fitted in the gap allowed - honestly - and it made using the toilet uncomfortable when seated. The rooms are small overall so this is part of their 'squeezing a lot into a little' design I guess - I would not stay there out of choice again. I still can't beat the Swissotel on Dam Square - it is just great.

Reviews.Title: “small but hip room”
Reviews.Author: wonderfulword
Reviews.Content: In Amsterdam most of the hotels are old fashionned but luckily the Tulip inn is modern, with great colors, Starck armchairs and design lights. The bathroom is great , the view from my room was very pleasant (a church and old dutch houses. My only complain will be about the size of the room, too small for 2 persons. But anyway a good deal for the price (89 euros).

Reviews.Title: “Very good location. Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MGreece
Reviews.Content: Only 5 minutes walk to Dam square and another 5 minutes from central station. The hotel was very clean and changed towels every day. A bit small room but thats all you need. Would go back to stay there again. The staffed helped us on what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: JaneBNorfolk_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on a flying visit to Amsterdam. The hotel was very conveniently situated - 15 mins maximum walk from Centraal station, which in turn is 10 minutes train journey from Schiphol. Our room was on the small side, but perfectly adequate for a short stay. The bathroom was newly fitted, small but quite impressive, with ample hot water etc. The atmosphere was pleasant, and service at breakfast was friendly. The Dam square area is not the most scenic area of Amsterdam; but 5 minutes' walk away we were in beautiful canal-side roads; and 5 minutes in the other direction we caught a boat trip round the canals. So, not the place for a long stay, but very good for a quick tourist visit.

Reviews.Title: “Uniquely decorated”
Reviews.Author: denisetexas
Reviews.Content: A modern hotel with elevator. Unique interior design in rooms, with floors and walls carpeted. Fairly spacious rooms, comfortable bed and linens, wall mounted plasma tv, small balcony. Bathrooms very nice, spacious, and modern. I don't recommend this hotel (or at least the level of accommodations we had there) for anyone not staying there with a spouse, significant other, or very close friend/family member - for the walls between the bathroom and rest of guestroom are made of glass, with only a narrow band of frosting for minimal privacy. Very convenient, central location. However, if booking a room during Queen's Day (Apr 30) festivities AND you want some peace/quiet, book in advance for a room that is not streetside. We got streetside and didn't care, we were so tired we slept well anyway despite the noise - but some people are more particular so I pass this advise along.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: TB15
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and in good condition and at a very reasonable price. The location was great, a short walk from Centraal Station and within walking distance of pretty much anything you'd like to see in the city centre. We had a great experience. As people have mentioned, the rooms were on the smaller side, but that would only be an issue for people if they were planning to spend their whole trip in their hotel room. We found the rooms comfortable and clean. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Evie_08
Reviews.Content: Easy to find from Centraal station, about 5 minute walk, on a busy main road but we had a deluxe room which had no traffic/people noise problems at all. Check in/out was painless and they were very helpful, provided you with a map & offered to hold your luggage on last day. Didn't bother with breakfast, seemed quite expensive at â‚¬15 per person. Rooms were great - compact but at the end of the day we were not looking for something palatial. Very clean, good housekeeping. Had all amenities we wanted, air con, sat tv, good shower, tea & coffee making. There's no room service.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: squigley
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights,hotel staff were great,nice and friendly,hotel is in a great location,we booked a delux double room,it was small but very clean and modern,lovely flat screen tv on the wall,bathroom door is made from glass,completely see tru,walked into door twice by accident,it was so clean you wudnt even know its there,the room had air conditioning which was great because it was warm when we were there,over all had a great stay and will be booking again for next year!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we used it for.”
Reviews.Author: CraigR232323
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on a short break with 10 other male friends. Make what you will of the other reviews here. Nowhere to unpack your suitcase? I always go for the bed, most are even bigger than my suitcase, thus making them useful for unpacking. Perfect! Dodgy part of town? This is central Amsterdam. I never felt unsafe anywhere around the hotel, even with just one or two friends in the small hours. It's fine. Check in was swift, despite usual form filing, with free tea and coffee available. Staff were great. Friendly and helpful. When I pressed the 5 button in the lift, it took me to the fifth floor, which was just sweet! The rooms are indeed pretty small, but have all the room you need. The wardrobe was small too, but again has all the room you need, as long as you left the ball gowns at home. I thought the glass bathrooms were amusing, and we partly booked the hotel due to these, just for a giggle. Air conditioning was a pretty powerful split unit and more than adequate. Its fan speeds and louvre (if requested) were effective and I found the whole experience to be thermostatically accurate. It made a slight hum, but they do though don't they, air conditioning units. The twin rooms (or at least six of them) are split matress doubles, but are pretty large, have a very good matress and two single douvets. It was no problem. No one ate breakfast in the hotel. There are a myriad of early morning eateries outside, from traditional Dutch to somewhere to get a bacon roll. For this reason all I can say is you can have breakfast at the hotel if you want. SImilarly, dinner. If you need somewhere to rest your head when on a trip with a group of friends, this place is perfect. If you won't be spending anytime other than sleep, showering and changing it, its value for money, clean, tidy and wholely pleasent.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms tiny but great location”
Reviews.Author: BarbieAM
Reviews.Content: We were only here for one night and that was about the most time you could comfortably stay here for. The room was very small and if we would have had suitcases I do not see that we could have unpacked them. Apart from that it was clean but a little noisy at night - but that is to be expected, I guess, in Amsterdam. TV and amenities all worked fine. The location was great - a short walk from the main train station which takes you straight to the Airport. It was also excellently placed for the sights of the City. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: numinor
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Tulip Inn hotel (formerly Ramada hotel) for a few days while doing a shopping spree. Although the hotel was bought by another hotel chain it is obvious that the hotel had no major refurbishment done to it. I found the staff friendly and helpfull as always and if I had wanted to do any excursions they would have organised it for me. The hotel is no more than 5 mins walk from Amsterdam central station and is located on and around one of the main shopping areas (Nieuwezijdse Vorburgewal & Kalver straat) making it very handy for anybody looking for a weekend breaks and shopping trips. The street is quite safe to walk down even late at nightdue to a police station being only a few doors down from the hotel. Although the rooms are basic in comfort levels (tea/coffee facil., safe in room, etc) the only gripe I had was with the tram line directly in front of the hotel. Currently floors 1 & 5 are smoking designated (for now) and the rest are non-smoking. If you do intend to stay in this hotel I would recommend a non-front facing room (unless you like the noise of trams from 6am-1am or are a sound sleeper). On the whole I found the stay most pleasant and will be returning there for the third time hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a stay!”
Reviews.Author: PaulSouthampton
Reviews.Content: Perfect location as it was only a 5 minute stroll from Central Station and the same into Dam Square. Rooms were excellent with a nice modern contemporary feel and very clean. However, our room was slightly on the small size. Will be staying here on my next trip to the dam.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: melodyelizabeth1
Reviews.Content: This hotel should have a 1-2 star rating. My cousin and I stayed there March 15-March 18, 2008. We booked a star/twin room. It was so small we could not unpack our belongings. It offered zero drawer(s) space. The "closet" was a narrow, open space in the wall, as you come in the room about 3 feet tall and 1-1/2 foot wide. We expected small, but not tiny! The bathroom is in the bedroom, with frosted glass walls around it. Very tacky, cheesy and motel like. If the configuration of the bed(s) had been different(the footboard is against the wall, instead of the headboard)it could have at least given us some walking room. The "twin" beds are actually one bed with split matresses. The matresses were confortable at least. The hallways are dark and dirty. The concierge on duty was very rude and unhelpful. For the price we paid, 298.00 Eur total($534USD)it was very mis-leading. Just imagine a motel on a road trip and you will have the Tulip Inn. The hotel is located in a rough area and I will never stay there again. We checked out and found another hotel for the same price, better area, real 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katienana
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and found it to be a great hotel. The room was small but it had everything we needed. The rooms are spotless and cleaned every day. The rooms can be cleaned up to 12.30pm which was very handy when we decided to have a lie in! All of the staff are friendly and very helpful and all speak good english which is handy. The only bad thing I have to say about the hotel is that there are renovations currently being carried out and the builders are very noisy to say the least and take note - the builders in Holland start work at 6.30am!! All in all we didn't let it ruin our stay and would definitely stay there again. Also the location is great really central just a 5 min walk to Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “value for money / excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JODIEHAYSTRAVEL
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in amsterdam. What a great hotel we usually stay in the sister hotel golden tulip amsterdam centre which is a 4 star but decided to try the tulip inn amsterdam centre a 3 star. The hotel is currently getting renovated and all rooms are being upgraded to star rooms which we stayed in they are very modern and clean.The reception staff are very helpful. It is a 5 min walk to dam square and a 15 min walk into the red light district. All in all an excellent location. I can recommed a great steak restaurant a few doors away from hotel called Tore dorada it has an open kitchen so you can watch your steak being cooked to perfection. There is an excellent floating chinese resturant called sea palace near to central station and i can also recommend a lovely indian restuarnt called memories of india - about a 20 min walk away. Oh and if your looking for a pub with a friendly atmosphere and great food i would recommend oreileys (irish pub) we always have a breakfast there!!!! So if your looking for a value for money hotel in a great location the tulip inn amsterdam centre is for you. I would also recommend the canal boats to get a good look at the city/ shopping is good/ sex museum and red light a great experience - i would give madam tussauds a miss as expensive and i dont feel it was worth it. Oh and the pancake bakery - yum yum the best in amsterdam. Amsterdam has something for everyone so give this hotel a go.

Reviews.Title: “OK--Central”
Reviews.Author: jmahon
Reviews.Content: About a 5-10 minute walk away from the main train station. Rooms a bit small (but i think this is the norm in the Netherlands). Central location, a few minutes walk from dam square. Breakfast in the hotel is your standard fare that you weoudl ge tin any hotel anywhere. Having breakfast in a cafe might be a better option.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, apart from the view”
Reviews.Author: vsewell
Reviews.Content: I never realised how important sunlight is to human beings until i stayed in this hotel. When we arrived in out room and opened the curtains we discovered there was a huge metal wall right outside the window blocking almost all natural light coming into the hotel room. Good for vampires, I suppose, but not really a good start to the holiday. so if you go to this hotel, and you're offered room 110, don't take it. Apart from this my other major complaint is that there was ridiculously loud construction work going on on the floor right above us, which started at 7am each morning, giving us both major headaches, and I'd say a lot of people travelling to amsterdam would prefer a bit of a lie-in in the morning... Apart from that, the hotel wasn't so bad. The lobby was very stylishly designed, it was situated near (but not too near) the red light district and the train station, and right beside the shopping area. Anyway, amsterdam is pretty small, so you could walk to pretty much anywhere you need to go. Breakfast was good too, lots of choice, probably my favourite part of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: slinkygoers
Reviews.Content: A group of 20 of us stayed at Ramada hotel. It is only a few minutes walk from Dam square & very close to the main station. The hotel was very clean, rooms were very nice but the layout inside them was slightly different as the bed was in the middle of the room but more importantly the bathrooms were just a glass panelled room in the cornier of the bedroom with only a frosted glass panel around the middle to try to keep some modesty - i wouldnt recommend this unless you know your fellow traveller very well!! Staff very helpful with maps, directions, etc..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but stay ruined by the construction work!”
Reviews.Author: Peppermint-Paty
Reviews.Content: We booked a fantastic deal through Hotel Connect.com, for Â£256 for 4 nights in a star room (1 night free for Sun / Mon / Tues arrival) - the website is great and posts you a booking pack with voucher & map etc. We arrived at the hotel about 3.30pm on the Monday to be told that major construction work was starting that day - and lasting for a few months and taking place during weekdays, but not weekends. The work is to convert the standard rooms to star / superior rooms, starting on the 3rd floor. We were staying on the 5th floor and were told we probably wouldn't be troubled too much by the noise as the construction work was taking place 2 floors away. As compensation, we were offered free full breakfast for our stay, so we thought, we'd see how it went... The Wed morning, the drilling started about 8am, and was just about barable - with the use of earplugs we bought the previous day! On Thursday morning, we were waken to the sound of blocks of debris being thrown from the fire escape a floor below, down 4 stories to a skip, then the drilling - at 7.30am! Arrgh!! Not the relaxing stay we had in mind. Even with earplugs - trying to sleep was useless. When my husband rang reception to ask what time the work is meant to start, he was told 8am. We waited until the manager started that day to complain - no refund was possible as we had booked through a pre-booking website, so we were given free tickets to the Van Gough museum, when all we wanted was a decent kip! We were moved to a room on the near side of the building, where the noise was meant to be quieter... but wasn't. As a consequence of our complaint, the work was held off until after 8am on the Thursday morning - then continued until 8pm to compensate for the late start! This put a real dampener on an othewise great choice of hotel. I have stayed at 5 hotels in Amsterdam, and this deal offered the best in terms of price, location and the star rooms are clean, modern and comortable. The full breakfast was plentiful in terms of choice for a 3 star hotel in Amsterdam and the standard good - although I did have a constuction worker trying to lean over my table by the window to pass an electricity cable through while I was eating! The rooms on the far side have a street view so good for people watching but the TVs have less choice and no pay movies. The near side rooms don't have much of a view but are slightly larger with the bed positioned right up to the wall with a mounted TV. The hotel seems to be changing from a Ramada to a Golden Tulip, so be aware of this when looking for it on the street. My simple advice about staying at this hotel? Good choice if you're stay is at the weekend when the work stops. Otherwise, think twice - I didn't expect to be looking forward to coming home from my holiday just to escape the constant banging and drilling. If you have already booked and can't cancel, request a room on the the top floor, the 6th floor which is non-smoking. At least then, you are furtheraway from the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the ramada Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: lou2995
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ramada from 30/12-01/01/08 we were pleasently surprised as we had got a good deal on the hotel. The rooms were spotless, basic but very clean and modern. The staff are very friendly and do all they can to help. It is located very centrally to all local coffee shops, restaurants(they also have there own restaurant), pubs and shops. Within walking distance to train station. Would go back tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “An experience in minimalism”
Reviews.Author: MizunguhowRU?
Reviews.Content: Lately I have been making a study of sorts about how little space one really needs to live comfortably, What with Flat screen TVs, Stereo equipment that gives fabulous sound from a shelf top unit the size of Kleenex box and all manner of other downsized home furnishings, who needs a â€œMc Mansionâ€�. So it was interesting to check in to a single â€œstarâ€� room at the Ramada City Centre Amsterdam. This is a small space about 6 x7 feet with a tiny triangular annex bathroom the size one might find in a train compartment. Some interior decorator went to incredible lengths to make this tiny space look larger than it is. The carpet runs up one wall. The bunk like bed is mounted against another and a desk and small closet complete the furnishings. The desk chair is clear Mylar plastic (and very uncomfortable). The strange (and I suspect rather expensive) bathroom door is made of heavy tempered glass, and swing s out not in. The middle of the glass is frosted but the top and bottom are clear creating an effect not unlike a public restroom. It does allow light to pass through making the space a bit brighter which was probably the idea. Staying in a single room alone this is innocuous enough but if one was sharing with anything but a very intimate (and good natured) partner it would be kind of creepy. The bathroom sink and small glass surround allows no space to put anything like cosmetics or even a tooth brush. Storing cosmetics on the floor may be a bit off putting especially for the ladies who may also not like the lack of a tub..Still except for these minor issues the space actually works and is quite comfortable. Honorable mention goes to the semi circular shower which actually has doors that close, not one of those silly glass half panels that European hotels often have. The bathroom actually stays dry. The price was reasonable by local standards especially when you factor in the free wireless Internet which can cost upwards of 22 Euro a day even in some 5 star properties in Amsterdam. Would I stay here again alone? Sure no problem. With a companion? Only if sheâ€™s a really good sport

Reviews.Title: “Small, yet well put together room.”
Reviews.Author: A2TMFK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night in a 'Star' room for 129euros. Asked for a smoking room and was given room 504, as you will see from the pic, rooms 502 - 504 are extremely close. This was the only big negative point I found, when someone lets the door close under its own weight, you know about it! At 07:00, I knew about it.. lol The room itself has been well designed placing everything into such a small space, it didnt bother me too much as I wasn't in there too long. One thing to note is that there is no mini bar so its a good idea to stock up upon arrival. The bathroom is A+ with a great shower and funky sink plenty of channels on the LCD and a Comfy bed. The back of the hotel shares a street with a small red light area and a Gay Cinema right next door. If your room looks onto the back street, you will cleary see the red lights, but don't let this bother you as it seemed very low key. I didnt use room service or the restaurant so unable to comment. Overall I think this is a good hotel, although there's plenty more to choose from and every time I go I will try a different one. Have stayed at about 10 so far and the best all round is the Barbizon Palace, although it will cost you a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: garryLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Great location ,less than ten minutes walk from Central Station and about the same again to Dam Square. Found the Hotel staff friendly and helpful during our stay. I suppose our room was of average size for Amsterdam that is to say not huge!! . the decor was a bit on the tired side, but it was clean. Our stay was mid week and although the hotel seemed busy we found it very quiet especially at night witch I suppose is a good thing. Overall I would say it is a good basic Hotel and for price and location it is certainly worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, dodgy room”
Reviews.Author: BigJimCardiff
Reviews.Content: Me and one of my mates went over to Amsterdam from Weds 26/09 to Sun 30/09. Got to the hotel at around 2pm, the reception area was very smart, and the reception staff were very quick and efficient. We had a star twin smoking room. We arrived in the room and it was 2 single beds stuck together, so you couldnt separate them. Also the bathroom wall was made of glass, with a bit of misted glass in the middle. The room itslef was great with flat screen TV, opening windows, air conditioning and tea/coffee making facilities. Its location is very good. Located at about the half way point between dam square and centraal station, it is easy to walk to from the station. There is a tram stop directly outside the hotel, which means if you want to go somewhere a little further afield, you can hop on a tram. However most things are walkable from here. Albert Heijn is on the same road as the hotel, by Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: lindaLLondon_Ontario
Reviews.Content: Satyed at this hotel Sept 15 - 17, 2007 and found it to be very 'tired' and simplistic. The lobby has been updated but once you arrive on your floor (2nd), the hallways are old, the room is very dated and very small though quite clean. Our standard room had a bathroom with toilet and shower and the sink/vanity was in the room itself divided from the sleeping area by a partition wall. The carpets, furniture and light fixtures were quite old and basic. There was no air conditioning and only a small fan to circulate air at night and as we were on the front of the hotel, we could not leave the window open at night due to the noise, The room was clean and the beds (two singles pushed together) were comfortable. There was little space to manuever or sit in the room with one small TV on the tabletop. The price we paid (about $475 Canadian) for 2 nights seemed steep for what we got though the breakfast buffet which was included in the price was pretty good (restaurant has been updated). Location close to the Centraal Station and central area was good and able to get to the sights on the bus very easily. Great East Indian restaurant about 5 places up from the hotel (towards Centraal Station). I guess there are 'star' rooms at this hotel which are an upgrade (and more money). Would think there must be a better place for the amount we paid in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Smelly carpets”
Reviews.Author: paddingtonian
Reviews.Content: that is all I can remember vividly about an otherwise unmemorable stay at this hotel. The trendy modernist re-decoration efforts are only superficial and seem to die out the closer you get to the place where you will actually sleep. Very strange diagonal distribution of spaces in the room, unusual partition wall between the washbasin, which is the first thing you see when you come into the room, and the sleeping area. The bathroom fixtures were dated and scaly. The lighting of the room was rather gloomy. Slept OK and staff were all right but would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, couldn't have worked out better.”
Reviews.Author: Lotty79
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in terms of location and friendly staff. Very easy to find from Central Station, and close to Dam Square etc... Only down side, was that our room (301) was very small, and as it was right next to the lift, we heard it all night long going up, and down. Other guests were noisey, but obvioulsly that's not the hotels fault, just very thin walls! But for a quick break, (we paid about 109Euros a night) it was worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “A little tacky”
Reviews.Author: Mins
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very convenient at the same time as not being in the 'thick' of the action. However, the room that we had was very noisy and you could hear the noise from other guests VERY clearly. In addition to this, we could hear the lifts constantly and there was no air con and no windows to open to get air so the room was very stuffy. We had to keep the door open and it felt like we were in a dorm! There is no character to the rooms and the hotel is very bland. However, for us it was a short stay so we didn't fuss about it as the location was ideal and that was the most important factor for us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Novel Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: madhollywood
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in early June and had a great time. We booked one of the Star Rooms and found it quite novel. It as great to lay in bed and watch the flat screen tv in front of you hanging on the (carpeted) wall. The room wasn't huge but we didn't have a problem with this. Also the glass walled bathroom was funny and perhaps not entirely suitable if you are travelling with friends. The location is perfect. Just a few mins walk from the station and just about everywhere else. I would say the location was the number 1 reason for staying here. All in all we found it to be clean, friendly and everything we hoped from a chain like Ramada. The added personality was a bonus. Reception also have a room for holding your luggage if you have a late flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: stjb
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a last minute trip to Amsterdam and managed to book this hotel the night before at a rate of 99 euros(!). The reception staff were friendly & helpful with directions. As other reviewers have mentioned, being walking distance to the train station and other sights/shopping/restaurants was the best part of the hotel. We did not eat at the hotel, there are so many options nearby. We stayed in a double room on the second floor, overlooking the street. It was a smoking room but I honestly could not tell! There was actually a pleasant clean smell throughout the hotel. The room & hallways are small and angular by North American standards, however it was spotless and comfortable for the 2 nights. There is a desk, chair, stool & TV in one corner. The bed was very nice and there is a bedside "shelf" and lamp on each side which is convenient. The open closet is small and also has some handy shelves. The shower was excellent and height adjustable. The lighting in the sink area was dim but good in the rest of the room (lots of natural light with good blackout-style curtains if needed). We had the window open at night (no AC in this room), the weather was mild during our stay. The only noise from the street was the trams which was completely tolerable as compared to the red light district! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Niall
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is superb, on the main street behind Damrak and not even a 5 minutes walk from Central Station. It is ideal for a stop over for a few nights, room was facing the street, but was noisy, tram bells ringing and when that stopped, people passing thru all night. The room was my choice, the non smoking room had no view, took the smoking room, so I got the sounds of Amsterdam full on !! The receptionists were very helpful, I did not eat there. For a one night stop over, with little time in the hotel, its perfect. Brilliant restaurants further down towards the end of the street. Booked hotel on its website about 8 days before, checked it again before I arrived and the room was 30E cheaper. Cancelled my original reservation and rebooked it, no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Central comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gautamghosh
Reviews.Content: Just a few minutes away from the Central Station, with trams stopping outside the hotel, this is a good location for anyone who wants to have the city at their fingertips. Despite the location beside a main road, noise levels were not disturbing, even with the window open. The Star room (apparently a deluxe room) had a decent standard incl. air conditioning, though it was a bit small. The glass cubicle that is the bathroom was novel but otherwise up to notch. We didn't eat any meals at the hotel since it only offers a continental breakfast buffet. The restaurants and pubs within 50-100 meters of the hotel offer much more sumptious breakfasts (pancakes, full English, etc) for much less than what the hotel charges. I'll stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: cherylbEssex
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel with excellent location, helpful staff and lovely room. The bed was very comfortable and a flat screen tv over the bed meant my husband could lie in bed and watch the football!!! We had a de-luxe "star room" which was fine for a couple but the glass walls of the en-suite meant it lacked privacy - maybe not ideal for "friends". Apparently the standard rooms do not have this. I would definately recommend this hotel - we felt comfortable, safe and it was very quiet in the room which is always a bonus. The occasional door shutting, but no talking or tv noise from other occupied rooms

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Jill_Travels
Reviews.Content: Had quite a few hotels to choose from in Amsterdam and am so glad I stayed here. Location is fantastic- 5 min walk to Central Station and Dam Square. Very stylish lobby, rooms small but have everything you need. Nice clean bathroom. I didn't need a fan or a/c (not even sure if the hoel has a/c) as the weather wasn't too hot. I had a window that looked into a shaft that runs down the middle of the hotel, but got some natural light and was able to tell the weather! Great food all around the hotel- didn't try the breakfast in the lobby. Too bad the restaurant at the hotel wasn't open for more than lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Tolerable for One Night”
Reviews.Author: NYMagpie
Reviews.Content: I recenty stayed at the Ramada Hotel in Amsterdam Centraal. The location is very convenient to the station and the city center and the intial impression of the decor in the lobby was good as well. The employees were a bit unenthusiastic and 'robotic' making one feel more like a pest than a guest. Despite my pre-arrival requests, I was only offered a smoking room which takes on an additional meaning in Amsterdam and smelled of both varieties upon entry to my room. The window did not open and the fan that came with the room rattled so much I could not use it or risk no sleep due to the noise making the room very warm and humid. My 'view' was a piece of sheet metal bolted over the exterior of my window. The room I had was very small and not very well lit. Shaving proved a challenge in the dark. Finally, it rained for quite some time the day I was touring the city so I was quite disappointed when I attempted to dry my shoes and the hair dryer in the room did not work as well. A colleague of mine stayed up the street at the Victorian which is approximately 30 euros mine. I also had the opportunity to see her room and based on her experience next time I think I will spend the bit extra to upgrade to there!

Reviews.Title: “Not great!”
Reviews.Author: wmb1
Reviews.Content: Other reviewers have mentioned great showers and great location and I wouldn't knock them on that. The hotel is rightly proud of its stylish and elegant front lobby and lounge area however, beyond that forget it. Once inside the hotel one is left with the feeling of being in the corridors of a student dorm. The room (a double, for which the full rate would have been 200 euros per night) was small, had no air conditioning, had a window that opened onto a small central shaft with no view of anything at all and just one small portable and very noisy fan to ease the heat. The room was infested with insects which left me horribly itching and bitten. Over-priced, under-sized, poor accommodation. I won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spreadborough
Reviews.Content: My mum & I stayed here back in Feb 07 (standard room at back of hotel). We really had a pleasant stay. Rooms were clean and the shower was really hot and powerful! I can't comment on the b'fast as we ate every meal out! There are some fab restaurants all within walking distance of the Ramada. Particularly the chinese which name escapes me for obvious reasons!!!! opp side of street from Ramada about 100metres on the left going in direction away from Central Station. I must really compliement the staff on reception - I was most impressed that they never once said our room number out aloud. If only all receptionists were as professional with female travellers. .. Location of hotel is great - about a 4-5min walk from Central Station with good links to trams etc. Returning to Amsterdam in July with my boyf - hopefully it is just as nice. I will do another review as have booked a 'Star Room' for my next visit! Oh and if you have room at back of hotel be prepared to see a few ladies in windows - as liberal minded as my mum is I must say her face at the window saying "Blimey - there is a woman dancing in the street in just a bikini" will always make me laugh! Happy Travelling .................

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Clean Hotel and Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: tai81
Reviews.Content: This was my 1st time at this hotel and i must say i was very impressed. The staff were very friendly and helpful and everything ran smoothly from the moment we arrived. The rooms were cleaned daily although this didn't acutally include fresh new bedding. The lobby and the rooms are very clean and well kept and the mattresses are the most comfortable i've ever sampled! The only bad thing about this hotel is the smell in the right lift and the corrdiors on the room floors, they smell quite badly but compared with the cleanliness and superb location it's a small issue to deal with. All in all it was a fantastic stay and I will most certainly be going back on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Wacky bathroom”
Reviews.Author: lewisgrish
Reviews.Content: It's certainly worth getting the "Star Rooms". Though quite small ( it's Amsterdam!) the rooms were well equipped, and well maintained. Breakfast was good and the staff cheerful. Great central location with good links to all public Transport. Try Humphreys restaurant on the opposite side of the road for a good quality budget meal and friendly staff. The only down side was that one of the lifts was incredibly smelly - apparently due to a problem in an adjoining building whose occupier was on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly cheap but certainly cheerful”
Reviews.Author: joyful_traveller1982
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I usually go to Amsterdam once or twice a year, as it is a beautiful place and we have both friends and relatives nearby. Whenever we can get a booking, we stay in the Ramada. It is not particularly cheap, middling in price, but it's location (within 5-10 minutes of Centraal Station, Dam Square, shopping areas and many nice restaurants and cafes) makes it worth it. It is a pretty standard 3 star hotel, but the thing that makes us return is that we have never had any even slight problem there - the staff have always been friendly and helpful, the rooms clean and (very) comfortable, and any requests we have made such as room service, questions about how to work the safe, or different bedding (I have allergies), have been promptly dealt with. If you are looking for somewhere clean and comfortable in a good location for a reasonable rate (has always been cheaper for us when booked in advance), then this hotel is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Simple Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdventuresInEurope
Reviews.Content: The Ramada Amsterdam City Centre is a very simple hotel very near the Main train station. Very good hotel. They always seem to have coffee available in the lobby. The hot breakfast is priced at a nice 10 euros. Their Star rooms are nothing special, not worth the extra $ in my opinion. Many Europeans stay at this hotel. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Uz27
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel 3 times. Always a good memory ))) Rooms not so big but it is Amsterdam ))) Avery hotel room here is small. Once it was coner room with very small window but avresing alse was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: wdje
Reviews.Content: A great hotel very central and reasonably priced. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the train station, dam square and the red light district. The trams run frequently passed the front of the hotel and are easy to use. You can buy a strippencart at the local supermarket (10 minute walk by turning right outside the hotel). The rooms are quite small but spotless. There is a tv with lots of english channels (even bbc 1...i was able to watch eastenders!!) and tea and coffee making facilities. There are some rooms that look into the reception area in the middle of the hotel instead of out onto the street. If you are offered one of these rooms try to change as there is very poor light and no fresh air. Also we booked our room throught the ramada website and the price was 99 euro for bed and continental breakfast!. This breakfast consisted of tea/coffee and unlimited croissant and pain au chocolat to be eaten in the foyer at their lovely large leather sofas and chairs. The american breakfast costs extra.

Reviews.Title: “Return from the Dam”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer024
