Reviews.Content: Amsterdam: Ramada City Centre Date: 9 January 2007 Reviewer: Trip Advisor Member, UK Just returned from very enjoyable first visit to the Dam - people there are all very friendly and helpful, stayed at Ramada City Centre which was ok - yes the rooms are small - tried to get us to upgrade for twenty-five euros per night (declined), just as well as later learned other people had upgraded but rooms were no bigger than the standard, still room was cleaned each day, bed comfy, clean towels, all that no problem, breakfast ok, location was excellent, just up the street from Dam Square. Weather was very wet and windy but didn't stop us getting around and seeing the sights - Anne Frank house a must see but be sure you have a good map to find your way around on foot. If you like a good steak try the Grasshopper Steakhouse/Restaurant down from Dam Square near the station, lovely Dutch pancake cafe just by the flower market should be visited. For a good laugh visit to Madam Taussaud's - well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: hazey
Reviews.Content: I'm a little late posting this review (my stay was in August) and I've read that things have changed with regard to building/road work being carried out in front of this hotel, but heres what I found: We also, were greeted with the news that our requested non-smoking room was not available. This did change our views and enjoyment of our stay here as the smoke seemed to seep through the walls at night and it smelled like someone was actually smoking in our room! This was definately the worse part for us. The double bed was very small, the room was small but not a problem. Our room rate did not include breakfast but there was free coffee and pastries available to all in the reception which was nice in the morning (apart from all the cigarrette smoke, but I think this is maybe the same everywhere in Europe) Location was great for access to and from the central station, roughly a 10 minute walk at the most. A slight walk to some areas but not a problem for us. Staff seemed helpful and friendly. Although we did have a note pushed underneath the door very late one night asking us to go to the reception. Heading straight there thinking there was a problem this only turned out to be a bill for the local taxes which they wanted us to pay straight away, I have no idea why this couldn't have waited until we checked out. Overall it had its good and bad points, it seemed reasonably priced compared to the standards and location of others, but next time I would maybe try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “loved our break in amsteram”
Reviews.Author: juleshop
Reviews.Content: just got back from a 3day 2night stay at the ramada hotel which actually isnt at all bad like some reviews my friends and i read!! which worried us a bit but then we got to the hotel and was pleasently surprised. ok the rooms are just ok but are clean and the staff were friendly. yes the hotel is near a gay cinema but saw nothing. also on one side of the hotel you can see the ladies busy in their windows touting for business which we just thought was funny, hey your in amsterdam!!! overall my husband and i plus our other friends really loved our stay and would definetly come again and stay at the ramada

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is one of the best hotels that i have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: sethamus
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel last year. We both found it to be a very good quality hotel It was very clean and well maintained. Our rooms were cleaned everyday to a high standard Also the breakfasts were excellent plenty of choice The staff were very freindly and very helpful We are coming back to amsterdam again in november we wanted to stay at the ramada but they were fully booked we were very disapointed. However we are now staying at the avenue hotel and if the service there is as good as it is at the ramada then i will be very happy! michele smith weston super mare England

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: valeriehamelinck
Reviews.Content: On September 21, 2006 I stayed 1 night in this hotel. The room was very small, could hardly get into the bathroom, "non-smoking-room", but I could clearly smell the heavy nicotine odeur in the sheets etc., staircases very noisy, slamming doors etc., but that was not the worst. At midnight roadworkers started a new shift and made such a noise that I couldn't sleep. At 0.30 hours I went to the reception and met approx 15 other guests with the same problem. The nightreceptionist was in a terrible position as the hotelmanager (by telephone) refused to deal with the matter. Several businessmen were very, very stressed, and holiday's were spoiled for other guests. The worst thing of it all is that Amsterdam is building a N/S metro and that part of this construction is taken place in front of this hotel. The expectation is that the N/S metro will be operable in 2013! . So the hotel-management KNEW and KNOWS that builders are working 24 hours a day in front of their hotel. valhamelinck@hetnet.nl

Reviews.Title: “I urge you to read this !”
Reviews.Author: londonguyb
Reviews.Content: Stay 3 nights - I urge you to read this ! I stayed at the hotel and booked an upfraded star room, as my friends had booked for me and was concerned about the hotel. I ahd a right to be!! Hotel Facilities are very poor. No room service. Restaurant is only open for 'breakfast' and thats a poor continental only. Star room: powdered milk only. No bath towels, only hand sized towels. No hotel bar. No mini bar. Slow response. Only one person on duty in whole hotel in eve/nights. when they are not at reception at nights (ie trying to deal with this persons complaints - security is a concern) TV/Radio/email did not work. Got moved to another romm after first night. Guess what, the same - again they couldn't fix it when I called. Note rooms, I had a double, are very very small. If you'd like a bath-note shower only. To make star rooms seem larger, bathrooms have glass walls. I was alone, but if you are sharing with a friend you may find this 'unsuitable' as far as privacy goes. Now here is an unusual one: if you are a large/broad person you may have issues sitting on the toilet! Its snug between the shower and wall in the bathroom! The space is as wide as the toilet bowl. i'm 6'3'' and my shoulders wouldn't fit into the gap ! Its amsterdam, so.... But if you have problems with a hotel ajoining a gay adult cinema and/or men visiting the prostitutes along one other side of the hotel then perhaps not for you. My friends stayed in the standard rooms at the same time. The room they were allocated had a soiled carpet. Nice! Good room points- nice shower, but again no bath. We prepaid for the room and had a reciept that said 'All taxes and surcharges paid'. We checked the hotel bill the night before we left and the receptionist said we owed taxes. We pointed out the reciept and he accepted this. My friends checked out early and with the same receptionist, and there were no charges. When I checked out later, I was informed I owed taxes. I explained what had already been said and my friends had not paid. The manageress said that was a mistake and they should have been charged. I asked for a refund to an amount covering the inconveinence of upgraded facilities that did not work and for having to change rooms. She refused, and I felt was rude to me. She stormed into the back office and disappeared ! Summary: bad customer service, hotel facilities are poor, area is not exactly the best, rooms are not to standard , you can do so much better for less money elsewhere in this great city

Reviews.Title: “Rooms ok, but extreme car-parking cost”
Reviews.Author: arminth
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights. Room was small but ok. Bathroom clean. Furniture need some refurbishment. Small TV, No Videotext. Important! If you travel with a car and want to leave it in the carpark (public carpark de kolk), consider additional 40â‚¬ per night !!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ramada”
Reviews.Author: porschej
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from our stay at the Ramada Amsterdam City Centre. The hotel is recently rennovated and has a beautiful decor in the lobby area. The staff is excellent at providing exceptional customer service. We arrived after traveling all day by train from Paris and upon our check-in learned our request of a double bed was not available. We were given an upgrade into one of their star rooms. If you chose to stay in this hotel, I highly suggest staying in one of their star rooms, it is absolutely beautiful!!! We loved the Ramada and will stay there again when in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: SBonnell
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. We stayed here for 3 nights in late June 2006. We had one of the â€œStar Roomsâ€� â€“ which had the whole â€œglass chamberâ€� bathroom thing described in earlier reviews. Different yes, but we found it quite interesting, and as it was just my wife and I, it was fine. The staff were helpful and friendly, breakfast was fine (and included in our rate). The train station is about a 5 minute walk, and dam square, the red light district, etc are very close by. The pedestrian way which begins directly across the street is great for quick food places, cafes, etc (try Semmyâ€™s â€“ a donair place about half ways down for a great lunch). We would stay here again if we go back to Amsterdam â€“ and if you can get an ok rate take it.

Reviews.Title: “choose this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tivocao
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ramada over Easter and I think it was a perfect choise. The hotel is located about 5 min walk from the central station, which is located 15 min from the airport with train (3,6â‚¬). We stayed in at Star Room at the 5. floor with at great view over the roof of Amsterdam. There was no noise at all to hear from our room. The room, yes it was'nt big but nice and very trendy. I also wonderd about about the glaswall to the bathroom - a bit strange if your are traveling with friends!. The Star rooms are only at the 5. and 6 floor, the other floors look old and used. We booked our room incl. breakfirst, but when we arrived we where told that that breakfirst was "french" which means only coffe and a crossint. If we wanted normal breakfirst we had to pay 7,5 â‚¬ each pr. day - which we then did and got a great breakfirst, but I think they could have informed os about the "french" breakfirst at booking it. Only at few minuts walk from the hotel are all the things you nead to se in Amsterdam. We also went to the flowerpark Keukenhof outside Amsterdam, great park with so many beautiful flowers. We took the train to Leiden and from there the bus directly to the park, it costed os about 25Â£ each incl. entrance and we spend most of a day there. In generaly all the people in Amsterdam are very helpful and nice and they speak very great english. Great city :-) A nice thing to know in Amsterdam is that in many turiststores you can by "fast track" tickets to all the museums - incl. Rembrandt and Anna Franck, which meany you then can go directly to the entrance, instead of standing in a very long line - Remember that.

Reviews.Title: “Glass bathroom walls!”
Reviews.Author: Steph1T
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel and a lot of money has been spent on it. It is in the process of being updated but wont be to everyone's liking. There was a bit of noise early morning but nothing too bad. Beds face the wall so that a tv can be placed on the wall with a desk behind the headboard. Very trendy and comfy but not very big. The real off putter for some people will be the bathroom, the walls are made of glass, and although the middle bit is supposedly frosted you can still see in, it's a bit weird. It was a shame because whoever designed the room obviously never stayed for a night, it was a bit impractical.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - But Shoddy Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went for a long weekend after reading up on the reviews of all the hotels before booking. We stayed fri to tues for Â£362 including breakfast through 'last minute' dot com. Unfortunately, the renavation working is still going on through floors 4, 5 and 6. And when we first arrived at the hotel it was in darkness, because the power had been taken down to fix the air con! We were pleasantly told that the builders were only in during the week from 8am to 4pm. So, we left our luggage and arrived after 2pm.. the official booking time. We were given a room on the 3rd floor, with only a view of other windows of the same hotel. The noise of the workmen was intense, but more importantly it was twin beds !! We were told there were not other rooms with a double bed. We eventually agreed to change rooms to a room with a view outside on the 1st floor, and they gave us bedding for a double bed to fit over our 2 single beds... it seems you have 2 specify that you want a double bed these days ! Back to the good points The hotel is in prime position to central station, and the main shopping area. Although there is a tram stop outside the hotel, the noise is not horrendous, but the trams are regular. Which, you don't complain about when your waiting for one !! the only run until 12.30. if you get a taxi, make sure you ask for the fare to be calculated on the meter, otherwise they will rip you off. Our first night back from the club area 'litesplace' was â‚¬15. The next night was â‚¬8 on a meter. Behind the hotel is a street with girlies at there red light windows.... its quite amusing to think there stuck there all night ! Breakfast is good, a nice variety of most things you would want. They only do three choice of hot food each day. Every day was scrambled egg, and then a choice of either bacon, sausage, little pancakes or some garlic potato thing which didn't look like something you would want to consume for breakfast ! we never ate in the hotel, mainly due the vast amounts of restaurants available. There is a nice steak house oposite the hotel, and a fitness first gym across the street. make sure you bring plenty of money with you, the cost of everything has gone up since we last went, and we managed to spend about â‚¬600, and only come back with 2 t-shirts !

Reviews.Title: “OK to stay”
Reviews.Author: Diemel
Reviews.Content: The Amsterdam Ramada has a good location. Near Central station. Public transport right in front of hotel. Lobby and restaurant recently refubished. Modern design. Good italian coffees! Rooms are small but efficient for 3 stars. The bed I slept in need to be replaced. When you have a room at the back of the hotel than take a look out the window. Surprise! You think you are in the red light district. Youre not, but some of the girls have there "red window" in this street. Overall OK. Nice breakfast buffet. Not overpriced â‚¬10 pp. Book the room on there website. I booked a special offer at an agent and turned out to pay â‚¬30 more than on there website.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel -”
Reviews.Author: Leanna1
Reviews.Content: My husband and two of our friends stayed at this hotel from the 5th till the 7th of Feb. I loved everything about it, ideal location and the staff was lovely and friendly. The hotel was clean and everything that we needed and wanted. Myself and my husband are going back in the summer to the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory choice”
Reviews.Author: Argentine-tourist
Reviews.Content: My family (husband, mother and teen-age niece) stayed four nights at the Ramada City Center and were satisfied with it. First the pros: you can walk there from the Central Station; it is very close to the Damrak (all the sightseeing tours leave from this street) and to the pedestrian streets; it is on a street packed with restaurants offering Chinese,English,Indian,Italian, Turkish and Argentinian food; the reception staff is excellent and go out of their way to help you; the rooms have all modern conveniences such as a safety box, a trouser press, a hairdryer, coffe-and-tea facilities; there are two elevators; breakfast is excellent and offers a wide range of food in a very attractively decorated room. Now for the cons: part of the building overlooks a side street which has a mini red-light district so that if you are on the lower floors you get a view of the open windows (now that I come to think of it, some might consider this a pro); some rooms are quite small; the reading light by the bed is insufficient for reading and in general the lighting in the room is poor, as well as the lighting in the sink area, where light is not adequate for shaving; there is an Internet point in the lobby, but you have to pay 6 Euro for one hour after which you are given a slip of paper with dozens of letters and numbers as username and password, but the second time I tried to access it I couldn't get in and I didn't get a refund, since I couldn't show that I had not used all of the alloted time. So, in average, I would say the hotel was OK for the price I paid: 104 Euro on weekdays and 114 on Saturday, per room, breakfast included (remember that the prices shown on the Internet do not include a local tax which is added on when you get there).

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the money”
Reviews.Author: Chorleyreview
Reviews.Content: We were lucky with our room, which was on the top floor overlooking the back of the hotel. We had a beautiful view across the whole of Amsterdam and of an annex of the red light district. (which was most enlightening!!!!) The room was big with a big bathroom. We had a look in at some of the other rooms on our floor when the maid was cleaning with doors open. They looked really pokey and their view was of the lift shaft. I think this was common of all floors. So i would recommend you view your room before you accept it. I think if you had a room at the front of the hotel this would be noisy but i think this would be the norm for most city centre locations. THe lack of air con would be a problem in the summer. Overall you get what you pay for, it was cheap when you book on line, a place to lay your head which is clean and the staff pleasant. Location brilliant close enough to drag your cases from Central Station. Amsterdam was brilliant. We were not into the coffee shops and red light district apart from a quick look to see!!! Beautiful parks, canals, laid back pubs, restaurants and clubs. The docks are lovely and the museums good value. Something for everyone. Walk away from the centre and you will love it!!
